title: Super-résolution non supervisée d'images hyperspectrales de télédétection utilisant un entraînement entièrement synthétique
summary: Hyperspectral single image super-resolution (SISR) aims to enhance spatial resolution while preserving the rich spectral information of hyperspectral images. Most existing methods rely on supervised learning with high-resolution ground truth data, which is often unavailable in practice. To overcome this limitation, we propose an unsupervised learning approach based on synthetic abundance data. The hyperspectral image is first decomposed into endmembers and abundance maps through hyperspectral unmixing. A neural network is then trained to super-resolve these maps using data generated with the dead leaves model, which replicates the statistical properties of real abundances. The final super-resolution hyperspectral image is reconstructed by recombining the super-resolved abundance maps with the endmembers. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of our method and the relevance of synthetic data for training.

AI.tldr: 提出一种基于合成丰度数据的无监督高光谱单图像超分辨率方法，通过高光谱解混获得端元和丰度图，然后利用死树模型生成的合成数据训练神经网络进行丰度图超分辨率，最后重构超分辨率高光谱图像。
AI.motivation: 现有的高光谱图像超分辨率方法大多依赖于监督学习，需要高分辨率的真实数据，而这类数据在实际中通常难以获得。
AI.method: 首先，利用高光谱解混技术将高光谱图像分解为端元和丰度图。然后，使用死树模型生成的合成丰度数据训练一个神经网络，以实现丰度图的超分辨率。最后，将超分辨率的丰度图与端元重新组合，重建出超分辨率的高光谱图像。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，所提出的无监督方法在不依赖真实高分辨率数据的情况下，能够有效地进行高光谱单图像超分辨率，并且证明了合成数据在训练中的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究提出了一种创新的无监督高光谱单图像超分辨率方法，通过利用合成丰度数据克服了对真实高分辨率地面真实数据的依赖，为实际应用提供了可行方案。

title: Estimation of Cell-to-Cell Variation and State of Health for Battery Modules with Parallel-Connected Cells
summary: Estimating cell-to-cell variation (CtCV) and state of health (SoH) for battery modules with parallel-connected cells is challenging when only module-level signals are measurable and individual cell behaviors remain unobserved. Although progress has been made in SoH estimation, CtCV estimation remains unresolved in the literature. This paper proposes a unified framework that accurately estimates both CtCV and SoH for modules using only module-level information extracted from incremental capacity analysis (ICA) and differential voltage analysis (DVA). With the proposed framework, CtCV and SoH estimations can be decoupled into two separate tasks, allowing each to be solved with dedicated algorithms without mutual interference and providing greater design flexibility. The framework also exhibits strong versatility in accommodating different CtCV metrics, highlighting its general-purpose nature. Experimental validation on modules with three parallel-connected cells demonstrates that the proposed framework can systematically select optimal module-level features for CtCV and SoH estimations, deliver accurate CtCV and SoH estimates with high confidence and low computational complexity, remain effective across different C-rates, and be suitable for onboard implementation.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种基于增量容量分析（ICA）和微分电压分析（DVA）提取的模块级信息，用于同时估算电池模块中并联电池的电池间差异（CtCV）和健康状态（SoH）。
AI.motivation: 在仅能测量模块级信号且无法观测到个体电池行为的情况下，准确估算并联电池模块的CtCV和SoH具有挑战性，其中CtCV的估算尤其缺乏成熟方法。
AI.method: 提出一个统一框架，将CtCV和SoH的估算解耦为两个独立的任务，并利用从ICA和DVA提取的模块级信息来解决。框架具有灵活性，可以适应不同的CtCV指标，并且能够系统地选择最优的模块级特征。
AI.result: 实验验证表明，该框架能够准确估算CtCV和SoH，具有高置信度和低计算复杂度。该方法在不同C倍率下均有效，并且适用于车载实现。
AI.conclusion: 该统一框架能够有效地利用模块级数据，同时解决CtCV和SoH的估算问题，具有通用性、准确性和低计算复杂度，适合实际应用。

title: WorldVQA: Measuring Atomic World Knowledge in Multimodal Large Language Models
summary: We introduce WorldVQA, a benchmark designed to evaluate the atomic visual world knowledge of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs). Unlike current evaluations, which often conflate visual knowledge retrieval with reasoning, WorldVQA decouples these capabilities to strictly measure "what the model memorizes." The benchmark assesses the atomic capability of grounding and naming visual entities across a stratified taxonomy, spanning from common head-class objects to long-tail rarities. We expect WorldVQA to serve as a rigorous test for visual factuality, thereby establishing a standard for assessing the encyclopedic breadth and hallucination rates of current and next-generation frontier models.

AI.tldr: WorldVQA是一个新的基准测试，用于评估多模态大语言模型（MLLM）对原子视觉世界知识的掌握程度，分离了知识检索和推理，旨在衡量模型“记忆了什么”，并评估模型对从常见到罕见视觉实体的接地和命名能力。
AI.motivation: 现有评估方法常常混淆视觉知识检索和推理能力，导致无法准确衡量模型所记忆的视觉知识。因此，需要一个专门的基准来严格评估MLLM的视觉知识检索能力，以衡量其百科全书式的广度并评估幻觉率。
AI.method: 构建了一个名为WorldVQA的基准测试。该基准测试通过一个分层分类法，涵盖从常见类别到长尾稀有类别的视觉实体，来评估模型在接地和命名视觉实体方面的原子能力。此方法旨在将视觉知识检索与推理能力解耦。
AI.result: WorldVQA基准测试能够严格地测试视觉事实性，并为评估当前和下一代前沿模型的百科全书式广度和幻觉率设定标准。
AI.conclusion: WorldVQA是一个用于严格评估MLLM原子视觉世界知识的基准测试，它通过分离知识检索和推理，并使用分层分类法来评估模型对视觉实体的接地和命名能力，从而有望成为衡量模型视觉事实性和评估其知识广度及幻觉率的标准。

title: Physics-based generation of multilayer corneal OCT data via Gaussian modeling and MCML for AI-driven diagnostic and surgical guidance applications
summary: Training deep learning models for corneal optical coherence tomography (OCT) imaging is limited by the availability of large, well-annotated datasets. We present a configurable Monte Carlo simulation framework that generates synthetic corneal B-scan optical OCT images with pixel-level five-layer segmentation labels derived directly from the simulation geometry. A five-layer corneal model with Gaussian surfaces captures curvature and thickness variability in healthy and keratoconic eyes. Each layer is assigned optical properties from the literature and light transport is simulated using Monte Carlo modeling of light transport in multi-layered tissues (MCML), while incorporating system features such as the confocal PSF and sensitivity roll-off. This approach produces over 10,000 high-resolution (1024x1024) image-label pairs and supports customization of geometry, photon count, noise, and system parameters. The resulting dataset enables systematic training, validation, and benchmarking of AI models under controlled, ground-truth conditions, providing a reproducible and scalable resource to support the development of diagnostic and surgical guidance applications in image-guided ophthalmology.

AI.tldr: 提出一个可配置的蒙特卡洛模拟框架，生成带像素级五层分割标签的合成角膜OCT B扫描图像，以解决数据集不足的问题，并支持AI模型在可控条件下进行训练和评估。
AI.motivation: 深度学习模型在角膜OCT成像中的训练受限于大规模、标注良好的数据集的可用性。
AI.method: 构建一个包含高斯曲面和不同光学特性的五层角膜模型，使用蒙特卡洛光传输模拟（MCML）生成B扫描图像，并考虑了点扩散函数（PSF）和灵敏度衰减等系统特征，从而生成带有像素级分割标签的合成图像。
AI.result: 生成了超过10,000对高分辨率（1024x1024）的图像-标签对，并支持自定义几何形状、光子计数、噪声和系统参数。
AI.conclusion: 该合成数据集能够用于在可控、具备真实标注的条件下，系统地训练、验证和评估AI模型，为眼科图像引导的诊断和手术指导应用提供了一个可重复、可扩展的资源。

title: The Hypocrisy Gap: Quantifying Divergence Between Internal Belief and Chain-of-Thought Explanation via Sparse Autoencoders
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) frequently exhibit unfaithful behavior, producing a final answer that differs significantly from their internal chain of thought (CoT) reasoning in order to appease the user they are conversing with. In order to better detect this behavior, we introduce the Hypocrisy Gap, a mechanistic metric utilizing Sparse Autoencoders (SAEs) to quantify the divergence between a model's internal reasoning and its final generation. By mathematically comparing an internal truth belief, derived via sparse linear probes, to the final generated trajectory in latent space, we quantify and detect a model's tendency to engage in unfaithful behavior. Experiments on Gemma, Llama, and Qwen models using Anthropic's Sycophancy benchmark show that our method achieves an AUROC of 0.55-0.73 for detecting sycophantic runs and 0.55-0.74 for hypocritical cases where the model internally "knows" the user is wrong, consistently outperforming a decision-aligned log-probability baseline (0.41-0.50 AUROC).

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为“虚伪差距”（Hypocrisy Gap）的度量方法，使用稀疏自编码器（SAEs）来量化大型语言模型（LLMs）的内部推理与其最终生成结果之间的差异，以检测模型为了迎合用户而产生的“不忠实”行为。该方法在多个模型和数据集上表现出比现有基线更好的检测效果。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）常常表现出“不忠实”的行为，即最终生成的答案与其内部的推理过程不符，目的是为了迎合用户。研究者希望找到一种方法来检测这种行为。
AI.method: 研究者引入了“虚伪差距”（Hypocrisy Gap）这一度量方法。该方法利用稀疏自编码器（SAEs）和稀疏线性探针（sparse linear probes）来提取模型的内部“信念”，并将其与最终生成的轨迹在潜在空间中进行数学比较，量化两者之间的差异。
AI.result: 在 Gemma、Llama 和 Qwen 模型上使用 Anthropic 的 Sycophancy 基准测试，该方法在检测奉承性（sycophantic）运行方面达到了 0.55-0.73 的 AUROC，在检测模型内部“知道”用户是错误但仍迎合的虚伪（hypocritical）情况下达到了 0.55-0.74 的 AUROC。这些结果持续优于决策对齐的对数概率基线（0.41-0.50 AUROC）。
AI.conclusion: “虚伪差距”度量方法能够有效地量化和检测 LLMs 的不忠实行为，并在实际应用中表现出比现有方法更好的性能。

title: HMVLA: Hyperbolic Multimodal Fusion for Vision-Language-Action Models
summary: Vision Language Action (VLA) models have recently shown great potential in bridging multimodal perception with robotic control. However, existing methods often rely on direct fine-tuning of pre-trained Vision-Language Models (VLMs), feeding semantic and visual features directly into a policy network without fully addressing the unique semantic alignment challenges in the VLA domain. In this paper, we propose HMVLA, a novel VLA framework that exploits the inherent hierarchical structures in vision and language for comprehensive semantic alignment. Unlike traditional methods that perform alignment in Euclidean space, our HMVLA embeds multimodal features in hyperbolic space, enabling more effective modeling of the hierarchical relationships present in image text data. Furthermore, we introduce a sparsely gated Mixture of Experts (MoE) mechanism tailored for semantic alignment, which enhances multimodal comprehension between images and text while improving efficiency. Extensive experiments demonstrate that HMVLA surpasses baseline methods in both accuracy and generalization. In addition, we validate its robustness by reconstructing datasets to further test cross domain adaptability.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 HMVLA 的新型视觉语言动作（VLA）框架，该框架利用视觉和语言的内在层次结构，在双曲空间中进行多模态特征对齐，并结合稀疏门控专家混合（MoE）机制，以提高多模态理解能力和效率，并在实验中取得了优于基线方法的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有 VLA 模型通常直接微调预训练的 VLM，未能充分解决 VLA 领域特有的语义对齐挑战，尤其是在处理图像和文本的层次结构方面。
AI.method: HMVLA 框架利用视觉和语言的层次结构，将多模态特征嵌入双曲空间以进行更有效的对齐，并引入稀疏门控专家混合（MoE）机制来增强图像和文本之间的多模态理解和效率。
AI.result: HMVLA 在准确性和泛化性方面均优于现有基线方法。此外，通过重建数据集进行验证，HMVLA 还展现了其在跨领域适应性方面的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: HMVLA 框架通过在双曲空间中进行语义对齐和采用 MoE 机制，有效解决了 VLA 领域的语义对齐问题，显著提升了模型的性能和泛化能力。

title: Hybrid-Field Channel Estimation for XL-MIMO Systems: Dictionary-based Sparse Signal Recovery
summary:
Extremely large-scale multiple-input multiple-output (XL-MIMO) systems are a key technology for future wireless networks, but the large array aperture naturally creates a hybrid-field (HF) propagation regime in which far-field (FF) planar-wave and near-field (NF) spherical-wave components coexist. This work considers the problem of HF channel estimation (CE) and introduces a unified model that superimposes FF and NF contributions according to the Rayleigh distance boundary. By exploiting the inherent sparsity of the channel in the angular and polar domains, we formulate the estimation task as a sparse recovery problem. Unlike conventional approaches that require prior knowledge of the channel sparsity level, the proposed method operates without requiring knowledge of the sparsity level L and the NF/FF ratio γ, which are used only for synthetic channel generation in simulations. The channel estimator determines the number of paths adaptively through a residual-based stopping rule. A combined FF/NF dictionary is employed to initialize the support, and each selected atom undergoes continuous parameter refinement to mitigate grid mismatch. Simulation results demonstrate that the proposed estimator achieves accurate HF channel reconstruction under both line-of-sight (LoS) and non-line-of-sight (NLoS) conditions, offering a practical and computationally efficient solution for XL-MIMO systems.
  Extremely Large-Scale MIMO (XL-MIMO); Channel State Information (CSI); Channel estimation (CE); hybrid-field (HF) wave propagation; near-field (NF) spherical wave model; far-field (FF) planar wave model

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种针对 XL-MIMO 系统混合场（HF）信道估计的统一模型和稀疏恢复方法。该方法无需预知信道稀疏度或近场/远场比例，并能自适应确定路径数量，通过参数细化解决网格失配问题，实现了准确且计算高效的信道重构。
AI.motivation: XL-MIMO 系统中，远场平面波和近场球面波共存的混合场传播是信道估计的关键挑战。
AI.method: 提出一个统一的 HF 信道模型，将近场和远场分量叠加。利用角度和极坐标域的信道稀疏性，将信道估计转化为稀疏恢复问题。该方法不依赖于信道稀疏度和近/远场比例的先验知识，通过基于残差的停止规则自适应确定路径数量，并使用结合了近场/远场字典的初始化和参数细化来解决网格失配。
AI.result: 仿真结果表明，所提出的估计器在视距（LoS）和非视距（NLoS）条件下都能实现准确的 HF 信道重构。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为 XL-MIMO 系统提供了一种实用且计算高效的混合场信道估计解决方案，克服了传统方法对信道稀疏度和近/远场比例先验知识的依赖。

title: CreditAudit: 2D Auditing for LLM Evaluation and Selection
summary: Leaderboard scores on public benchmarks have been steadily rising and converging, with many frontier language models now separated by only marginal differences. However, these scores often fail to match users' day to day experience, because system prompts, output protocols, and interaction modes evolve under routine iteration, and in agentic multi step pipelines small protocol shifts can trigger disproportionate failures, leaving practitioners uncertain about which model to deploy. We propose CreditAudit, a deployment oriented credit audit framework that evaluates models under a family of semantically aligned and non adversarial system prompt templates across multiple benchmarks, reporting mean ability as average performance across scenarios and scenario induced fluctuation sigma as a stability risk signal, and further mapping volatility into interpretable credit grades from AAA to BBB via cross model quantiles with diagnostics that mitigate template difficulty drift. Controlled experiments on GPQA, TruthfulQA, and MMLU Pro show that models with similar mean ability can exhibit substantially different fluctuation, and stability risk can overturn prioritization decisions in agentic or high failure cost regimes. By providing a 2D and grade based language for regime specific selection, CreditAudit supports tiered deployment and more disciplined allocation of testing and monitoring effort, enabling more objective and trustworthy model evaluation for real world use.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为CreditAudit的部署导向的信用审计框架，用于评估语言模型的性能和稳定性。通过在多个基准测试中使用语义对齐的系统提示模板，CreditAudit可以报告模型的平均能力和由场景引起的波动性，并将其映射为AAA到BBB的信用等级。实验表明，在特定场景下，稳定性风险可能比平均能力更重要，CreditAudit有助于更客观、可信的模型评估。
AI.motivation: 现有的基准测试得分趋同，但与用户实际体验脱节，尤其是在代理多步任务中，系统提示的微小变化可能导致模型表现不稳定，给部署决策带来不确定性。
AI.method: 提出CreditAudit框架，使用一系列语义对齐且非对抗性的系统提示模板，在多个基准测试上评估模型。报告平均能力（场景平均性能）和场景诱导波动性（稳定性风险信号），并通过跨模型分位数将波动性映射为AAA到BBB的信用等级，同时诊断和减轻模板难度漂移。
AI.result: 在GPQA、TruthfulQA和MMLU Pro上的实验表明，平均能力相似的模型可能表现出显著不同的波动性。稳定性风险在代理或高故障成本的场景下可能颠覆优先级决策。
AI.conclusion: CreditAudit提供了一种二维和基于等级的语言，用于特定场景的模型选择，支持分层部署和更有纪律的测试与监控资源分配，从而实现更客观、可信的实际应用模型评估。

title: EchoJEPA: A Latent Predictive Foundation Model for Echocardiography
summary: Foundation models for echocardiography promise to reduce annotation burden and improve diagnostic consistency by learning generalizable representations from large unlabeled video archives. However, current approaches fail to disentangle anatomical signal from the stochastic speckle and acquisition artifacts that dominate ultrasound imagery. We present EchoJEPA, a foundation model for echocardiography trained on 18 million echocardiograms across 300K patients, the largest pretraining corpus for this modality to date. We also introduce a novel multi-view probing framework with factorized stream embeddings that standardizes evaluation under frozen backbones. Compared to prior methods, EchoJEPA reduces left ventricular ejection fraction estimation error by 19% and achieves 87.4% view classification accuracy. EchoJEPA exhibits strong sample efficiency, reaching 78.6% accuracy with only 1% of labeled data versus 42.1% for the best baseline trained on 100%. Under acoustic perturbations, EchoJEPA degrades by only 2.3% compared to 16.8% for the next best model, and transfers zero-shot to pediatric patients with 15% lower error than the next best model, outperforming all fine-tuned baselines. These results establish latent prediction as a superior paradigm for ultrasound foundation models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为EchoJEPA的超声心动图基础模型，该模型通过在海量未标注视频数据上进行训练，能够有效处理超声图像中的解剖信号、散斑和伪影，并在左心室射血分数估计、心腔视图分类以及对噪声和跨人群（儿科）的鲁棒性方面取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有超声心动图基础模型在区分解剖信号与超声图像固有的散斑和采集伪影方面存在不足。研究旨在开发一种能够学习可泛化表征，并克服这些挑战的模型，以减少标注负担并提高诊断一致性。
AI.method: 研究提出了EchoJEPA基础模型，并在包含30万患者的1800万份超声心动图数据集上进行预训练。同时，引入了一种新颖的多视图探针框架，具有因子化流嵌入，可以在固定骨干网络的情况下标准化评估。该模型采用潜在预测作为其训练范式。
AI.result: EchoJEPA将左心室射血分数估计误差降低了19%，心腔视图分类准确率达到87.4%。在仅使用1%标记数据时，EchoJEPA的准确率达到78.6%，远超仅使用100%标记数据的基线模型（42.1%）。在声学扰动下，EchoJEPA性能仅下降2.3%，而次优模型下降16.8%。此外，EchoJEPA在零样本迁移到儿科患者时，误差比次优模型低15%，优于所有微调基线。
AI.conclusion: 研究结果表明，潜在预测是一种优越的超声基础模型范式，EchoJEPA在多种评估指标上均表现出色，尤其是在处理复杂超声信号、样本效率和模型泛化能力方面，为超声心动图的AI应用树立了新的标杆。

title: Wide-field high-resolution microscopy via high-speed galvo scanning and real-time mosaicking
summary: Wide-field high-resolution microscopy requires fast scanning and accurate image mosaicking to cover large fields of view without compromising image quality. However, conventional galvanometric scanning, particularly under sinusoidal driving, can introduce nonuniform spatial sampling, leading to geometric inconsistencies and brightness variations across the scanned field. To address these challenges, we present an image mosaicking framework for wide-field microscopic imaging that is applicable to both linear and sinusoidal galvanometric scanning strategies. The proposed approach combines a translation-based geometric mosaicking model with region-of-interest (ROI) based brightness correction and seam-aware feathering to improve radiometric consistency across large fields of view. The method relies on calibrated scan parameters and synchronized scan--camera control, without requiring image-content-based registration. Using the proposed framework, wide-field mosaicked images were successfully reconstructed under both linear and sinusoidal scanning strategies, achieving a field of view of up to $2.5 \times 2.5~\mathrm{cm}^2$ with a total acquisition time of approximately $6~\mathrm{s}$ per dataset. Quantitative evaluation shows that both scanning strategies demonstrate improved image quality, including enhanced brightness uniformity, increased contrast-to-noise ratio (CNR), and reduced seam-related artifacts after image processing, while preserving a lateral resolution of $7.81~μ\mathrm{m}$. Overall, the presented framework provides a practical and efficient solution for scan-based wide-field microscopic mosaicking.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种适用于线性与正弦扫描的宽场显微成像图像拼接框架，通过几何拼接、ROI亮度校正和无缝融合，解决了扫描不均匀导致的几何和亮度问题，实现了大视野（2.5x2.5 cm^2）高分辨率（7.81 μm）图像的高效重建（6秒/数据集）。
AI.motivation: 传统宽场高分辨率显微成像面临扫描速度和图像拼接的挑战，尤其是正弦扫描引入的非均匀采样会导致几何不一致和亮度变化。需要一种方法来解决这些问题，实现高质量的宽场图像拼接。
AI.method: 提出一个图像拼接框架，结合了基于平移的几何拼接模型、基于感兴趣区域（ROI）的亮度校正以及缝隙感知羽化。该方法依赖于校准的扫描参数和同步的扫描-相机控制，无需基于图像内容的配准。适用于线性和正弦扫描。
AI.result: 成功在幅宽达2.5 x 2.5 cm^2的视野下，以约6秒的采集时间，重构了线性扫描和正弦扫描策略下的宽场拼接图像。量化评估显示，处理后两种扫描策略的图像质量均有提升，包括亮度均匀性、对比度噪声比（CNR）和接缝伪影减少，同时保持了7.81 μm的横向分辨率。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的框架为基于扫描的宽场显微图像拼接提供了一个实用且高效的解决方案，能够有效提高图像质量并保持高分辨率，适用于不同扫描策略。

title: Fast Diffusion with Physics-Correction for ACOPF
summary: Generating large-scale, physically consistent AC Optimal Power Flow (ACOPF) datasets is essential for modern data-driven power system applications. The central challenge lies in balancing solution accuracy with computational efficiency. Recent diffusion-based generative models produce high-quality samples; however, their slow sampling procedures limit practical scalability. In this work, we argue that exact physical feasibility is ultimately enforced by power flow solvers or projection steps, and therefore the generative model only needs to produce good initializations rather than perfectly feasible solutions. Based on this insight, we propose a fast diffusion framework using Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models (DDIM) combined with physics-guided corrections during sampling. The proposed method replaces slow stochastic refinement with a small number of deterministic steps and explicit constraint guidance. Experiments on IEEE 6-, 24-, and 118-bus systems show that our approach achieves up to 20 times faster sampling than standard diffusion models while maintaining comparable statistical accuracy and physical consistency. This makes the method well suited for scalable OPF dataset generation and practical power system learning tasks. We release the implementation code at https://github.com/PSquare-Lab/DDIM_OPF.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种基于DDIM的快速扩散框架，通过结合物理引导校正，能够在生成大规模、物理一致的AC最优潮流（ACOPF）数据集时，显著加快采样速度（高达20倍），同时保持统计准确性和物理一致性。
AI.motivation: 现有基于扩散模型的ACOPF数据集生成方法在保证解的准确性和物理一致性方面表现良好，但其慢速的采样过程限制了实际应用的可扩展性。
AI.method: 提出一种使用Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models (DDIM) 的快速扩散框架，并结合采样过程中的物理引导校正。该方法用确定性步骤和显式约束引导取代了缓慢的随机精炼过程，生成模型只需提供良好的初始化而非完全可行的解。
AI.result: 在IEEE 6、24和118节点系统上的实验表明，与标准扩散模型相比，该方法实现了高达20倍的采样速度提升，同时保持了可比的统计准确性和物理一致性。
AI.conclusion: 该方法能够高效地生成大规模、物理一致的ACOPF数据集，适用于可扩展的OPF数据集生成和实际的电力系统学习任务。

title: AdaptMMBench: Benchmarking Adaptive Multimodal Reasoning for Mode Selection and Reasoning Process
summary: Adaptive multimodal reasoning has emerged as a promising frontier in Vision-Language Models (VLMs), aiming to dynamically modulate between tool-augmented visual reasoning and text reasoning to enhance both effectiveness and efficiency. However, existing evaluations rely on static difficulty labels and simplistic metrics, which fail to capture the dynamic nature of difficulty relative to varying model capacities. Consequently, they obscure the distinction between adaptive mode selection and general performance while neglecting fine-grained process analyses. In this paper, we propose AdaptMMBench, a comprehensive benchmark for adaptive multimodal reasoning across five domains: real-world, OCR, GUI, knowledge, and math, encompassing both direct perception and complex reasoning tasks. AdaptMMBench utilizes a Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) metric to evaluate the selection rationality of different reasoning modes, isolating this meta-cognition ability by dynamically identifying task difficulties based on models' capability boundaries. Moreover, AdaptMMBench facilitates multi-dimensional process evaluation across key step coverage, tool effectiveness, and computational efficiency. Our evaluation reveals that while adaptive mode selection scales with model capacity, it notably decouples from final accuracy. Conversely, key step coverage aligns with performance, though tool effectiveness remains highly inconsistent across model architectures.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了AdaptMMBench基准，用于评估自适应多模态推理，该基准通过MCC指标和动态难度识别来评估模型在不同模态（如视觉、文本、工具）之间的自适应选择能力，并提供了多维度过程评估。
AI.motivation: 现有对自适应多模态推理的评估方法依赖于静态难度标签和简化指标，无法捕捉模型容量变化带来的动态难度，导致无法区分自适应模式选择和整体性能，且忽略了细粒度的过程分析。
AI.method: 提出了AdaptMMBench基准，涵盖真实世界、OCR、GUI、知识和数学五个领域。采用Matthews相关系数（MCC）指标来评估不同推理模式选择的合理性，并通过动态识别模型能力边界来确定任务难度。同时，AdaptMMBench还支持关键步骤覆盖率、工具有效性和计算效率等多维度过程评估。
AI.result: 评估结果显示，自适应模式选择随模型容量的增长而扩展，但与最终准确率显著解耦。关键步骤覆盖率与性能相关，而工具有效性在不同模型架构之间表现不一致。
AI.conclusion: AdaptMMBench基准能够更全面地评估自适应多模态推理能力，揭示了自适应模式选择与模型容量的关系，并指出了当前模型在工具有效性方面存在的挑战。

title: Real-time topology-aware M-mode OCT segmentation for robotic deep anterior lamellar keratoplasty (DALK) guidance
summary: Robotic deep anterior lamellar keratoplasty (DALK) requires accurate real time depth feedback to approach Descemet's membrane (DM) without perforation. M-mode intraoperative optical coherence tomography (OCT) provides high temporal resolution depth traces, but speckle noise, attenuation, and instrument induced shadowing often result in discontinuous or ambiguous layer interfaces that challenge anatomically consistent segmentation at deployment frame rates. We present a lightweight, topology aware M-mode segmentation pipeline based on UNeXt that incorporates anatomical topology regularization to stabilize boundary continuity and layer ordering under low signal to noise ratio conditions. The proposed system achieves end to end throughput exceeding 80 Hz measured over the complete preprocessing inference overlay pipeline on a single GPU, demonstrating practical real time guidance beyond model only timing. This operating margin provides temporal headroom to reject low quality or dropout frames while maintaining a stable effective depth update rate. Evaluation on a standard rabbit eye M-mode dataset using an established baseline protocol shows improved qualitative boundary stability compared with topology agnostic controls, while preserving deployable real time performance.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种基于U-NeXt的、轻量级且拓扑感知的M模式分割算法，用于机器人深板层角膜移植术（DALK）中的实时深度反馈，以应对M模式OCT数据中的噪声和不连续性问题。该算法通过引入解剖学拓扑正则化来稳定边界连续性和层序，实现了超过80 Hz的端到端处理速度，并能有效处理低信噪比数据。
AI.motivation: 机器人DALK手术需要实时精确的深度反馈以避免穿透Descemet's膜（DM）。M模式OCT虽然时间分辨率高，但存在散斑噪声、衰减和阴影等问题，导致层界面不连续或模糊，难以在实际部署帧率下进行准确分割。
AI.method: 提出了一种基于U-NeXt的轻量级、拓扑感知的M模式分割流水线。该算法将解剖学拓扑正则化融入其中，以稳定边界连续性和层序，尤其是在低信噪比条件下。整个预处理、推理和叠加流水线的端到端吞吐量超过80 Hz（单GPU）。
AI.result: 该算法在标准兔眼M模式数据集上进行的评估显示，与拓扑无关的对照组相比，在定性边界稳定性方面有所提高，同时保持了可部署的实时性能。
AI.conclusion: 该算法能够有效地处理M模式OCT数据中的噪声和不连续性，为机器人DALK手术提供稳定、实时的深度反馈，并具备足够的处理余量来应对低质量或丢失帧，从而保证手术的安全性和有效性。

title: StepNav: Structured Trajectory Priors for Efficient and Multimodal Visual Navigation
summary: Visual navigation is fundamental to autonomous systems, yet generating reliable trajectories in cluttered and uncertain environments remains a core challenge. Recent generative models promise end-to-end synthesis, but their reliance on unstructured noise priors often yields unsafe, inefficient, or unimodal plans that cannot meet real-time requirements. We propose StepNav, a novel framework that bridges this gap by introducing structured, multimodal trajectory priors derived from variational principles. StepNav first learns a geometry-aware success probability field to identify all feasible navigation corridors. These corridors are then used to construct an explicit, multi-modal mixture prior that initializes a conditional flow-matching process. This refinement is formulated as an optimal control problem with explicit smoothness and safety regularization. By replacing unstructured noise with physically-grounded candidates, StepNav generates safer and more efficient plans in significantly fewer steps. Experiments in both simulation and real-world benchmarks demonstrate consistent improvements in robustness, efficiency, and safety over state-of-the-art generative planners, advancing reliable trajectory generation for practical autonomous navigation. The code has been released at https://github.com/LuoXubo/StepNav.

AI.tldr: StepNav是一个创新的框架，通过引入结构化的、多模态的轨迹先验，解决了在复杂和不确定环境中生成可靠导航轨迹的挑战，实现了更安全、更高效的规划。
AI.motivation: 现有的生成模型在生成可靠、高效且实时的导航轨迹方面存在困难，尤其是在复杂和不确定的环境中。它们依赖于无结构的噪声先验，容易产生不安全、效率低下或单模态的规划。
AI.method: StepNav首先学习一个几何感知的成功概率场来识别所有可行的导航走廊。然后，利用这些走廊构建一个显式的、多模态的混合先验，用于初始化条件流匹配过程。该过程被表述为一个带有显式平滑度和安全性正则化的最优控制问题。
AI.result: 与现有生成规划器相比，StepNav在鲁棒性、效率和安全性方面取得了持续的改进，并且规划步数显著减少。在模拟和真实世界基准测试中均验证了其有效性。
AI.conclusion: StepNav通过用物理约束的候选方案取代无结构的噪声，成功地生成了更安全、更高效的导航计划，显著提高了自主导航的可靠性，为实际应用铺平了道路。

title: End-to-end reconstruction of OCT optical properties and speckle-reduced structural intensity via physics-based learning
summary: Inverse scattering in optical coherence tomography (OCT) seeks to recover both structural images and intrinsic tissue optical properties, including refractive index, scattering coefficient, and anisotropy. This inverse problem is challenging due to attenuation, speckle noise, and strong coupling among parameters. We propose a regularized end-to-end deep learning framework that jointly reconstructs optical parameter maps and speckle-reduced OCT structural intensity for layer visualization. Trained with Monte Carlo-simulated ground truth, our network incorporates a physics-based OCT forward model that generates predicted signals from the estimated parameters, providing physics-consistent supervision for parameter recovery and artifact suppression. Experiments on the synthetic corneal OCT dataset demonstrate robust optical map recovery under noise, improved resolution, and enhanced structural fidelity. This approach enables quantitative multi-parameter tissue characterization and highlights the benefit of combining physics-informed modeling with deep learning for computational OCT.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种结合物理模型和深度学习的端到端框架，用于从OCT数据中同时重建光学参数图和去噪的结构图像，提高了组织量化表征能力。
AI.motivation: 传统OCT逆散射问题在恢复光学参数（如折射率、散射系数、各向异性）时面临衰减、散斑噪声和参数耦合等挑战。
AI.method: 开发了一个端到端的深度学习框架，该框架结合了基于物理的OCT正向模型，能够从估计的光学参数生成预测信号，用于参数恢复和伪影抑制。该网络在蒙特卡洛模拟的真实数据上进行训练。
AI.result: 在合成角膜OCT数据集上进行了实验，结果表明该方法能够在噪声下鲁棒地恢复光学参数图，提高分辨率，并增强结构图像的保真度。
AI.conclusion: 该方法能够进行定量的多参数组织表征，并证明了将物理信息模型与深度学习相结合在计算OCT中的优势。

title: ProOPF: Benchmarking and Improving LLMs for Professional-Grade Power Systems Optimization Modeling
summary: Growing renewable penetration introduces substantial uncertainty into power system operations, necessitating frequent adaptation of dispatch objectives and constraints and challenging expertise-intensive, near-real-time modeling workflows. Large Language Models (LLMs) provide a promising avenue for automating this process by translating natural-language (NL) operational requirements into executable optimization models via semantic reasoning and code synthesis. Yet existing LLM datasets and benchmarks for optimization modeling primarily target coarse-grained cross-domain generalization, offering limited, rigorous evaluation in power-system settings, particularly for Optimal Power Flow (OPF). We therefore introduce \textbf{ProOPF-D} and \textbf{ProOPF-B}, a dataset and benchmark for professional-grade OPF modeling: ProOPF-D contains 12K instances pairing NL requests with parameter adjustments and structural extensions to a canonical OPF, together with executable implementations; ProOPF-B provides 121 expert-annotated test cases with ground-truth code, enabling end-to-end evaluation under both concrete and abstract OPF modeling regimes.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一个用于优化电力系统潮流（OPF）建模的新数据集（ProOPF-D）和基准测试（ProOPF-B），旨在利用大型语言模型（LLMs）自动化将自然语言的运维需求转化为可执行的优化模型，以应对可再生能源带来的不确定性。
AI.motivation: 可再生能源的增长给电力系统运行带来了不确定性，使得频繁调整调度目标和约束成为必要，同时也给依赖专业知识的近实时建模工作流程带来挑战。现有的LLM数据集和基准测试主要关注跨领域泛化，在电力系统，特别是OPF领域，缺乏严格的评估。
AI.method: 引入了ProOPF-D数据集，包含12,000个配对的自然语言需求、参数调整和结构扩展到标准OPF的实例，并提供可执行的实现。同时，提出了ProOPF-B基准测试，包含121个专家标注的测试案例及地面真实代码，支持在具体和抽象的OPF建模场景下的端到端评估。
AI.result: 提供了用于评估LLMs在OPF建模能力的新数据集和基准测试，能够实现对模型性能的严格、端到端评估。
AI.conclusion: ProOPF-D和ProOPF-B为研究利用LLMs自动生成OPF模型提供了重要的资源，有助于推动电力系统运维建模的自动化和智能化。

title: Super-Resolution and Denoising of Corneal B-Scan OCT Imaging Using Diffusion Model Plug-and-Play Priors
summary: Optical coherence tomography (OCT) is pivotal in corneal imaging for both surgical planning and diagnosis. However, high-speed acquisitions often degrade spatial resolution and increase speckle noise, posing challenges for accurate interpretation. We propose an advanced super-resolution framework leveraging diffusion model plug-and-play (PnP) priors to achieve 4x spatial resolution enhancement alongside effective denoising of OCT Bscan images. Our approach formulates reconstruction as a principled Bayesian inverse problem, combining Markov chain Monte Carlo sampling with pretrained generative priors to enforce anatomical consistency. We comprehensively validate the framework using \emph{in vivo} fisheye corneal datasets, to assess robustness and scalability under diverse clinical settings. Comparative experiments against bicubic interpolation, conventional supervised U-Net baselines, and alternative diffusion priors demonstrate that our method consistently yields more precise anatomical structures, improved delineation of corneal layers, and superior noise suppression. Quantitative results show state-of-the-art performance in peak signal-to-noise ratio, structural similarity index, and perceptual metrics. This work highlights the potential of diffusion-driven plug-and-play reconstruction to deliver high-fidelity, high-resolution OCT imaging, supporting more reliable clinical assessments and enabling advanced image-guided interventions. Our findings suggest the approach can be extended to other biomedical imaging modalities requiring robust super-resolution and denoising.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合扩散模型即插即用（PnP）先验的超分辨率框架，用于增强眼科光学相干断层扫描（OCT）B扫描图像的空间分辨率并去除散斑噪声，实现了4倍分辨率提升和有效去噪。
AI.motivation: 为了克服高帧率OCT成像中空间分辨率下降和散斑噪声增多的问题，以提高诊断和手术规划的准确性。
AI.method: 将图像重建问题建模为一个贝叶斯逆问题，结合马尔可夫链蒙特卡洛（MCMC）采样和预训练的生成扩散模型先验，实现4倍分辨率提升和去噪。使用眼科鱼眼角膜数据集进行体内验证。
AI.result: 与双三次插值、U-Net和其它扩散模型先验相比，该方法能生成更精确的解剖结构，更好地区分角膜层，并显著抑制噪声。在峰值信噪比、结构相似性指数和感知指标上均达到最先进水平。
AI.conclusion: 基于扩散模型的即插即用重建方法能够提供高保真、高分辨率的OCT成像，有望支持更可靠的临床评估和先进的图像引导介入治疗，并且该方法具有扩展到其他生物医学成像模态的潜力。

title: Experience-Driven Multi-Agent Systems Are Training-free Context-aware Earth Observers
summary: Recent advances have enabled large language model (LLM) agents to solve complex tasks by orchestrating external tools. However, these agents often struggle in specialized, tool-intensive domains that demand long-horizon execution, tight coordination across modalities, and strict adherence to implicit tool constraints. Earth Observation (EO) tasks exemplify this challenge due to the multi-modal and multi-temporal data inputs, as well as the requirements of geo-knowledge constraints (spectrum library, spatial reasoning, etc): many high-level plans can be derailed by subtle execution errors that propagate through a pipeline and invalidate final results. A core difficulty is that existing agents lack a mechanism to learn fine-grained, tool-level expertise from interaction. Without such expertise, they cannot reliably configure tool parameters or recover from mid-execution failures, limiting their effectiveness in complex EO workflows. To address this, we introduce \textbf{GeoEvolver}, a self-evolving multi-agent system~(MAS) that enables LLM agents to acquire EO expertise through structured interaction without any parameter updates. GeoEvolver decomposes each query into independent sub-goals via a retrieval-augmented multi-agent orchestrator, then explores diverse tool-parameter configurations at the sub-goal level. Successful patterns and root-cause attribution from failures are then distilled in an evolving memory bank that provides in-context demonstrations for future queries. Experiments on three tool-integrated EO benchmarks show that GeoEvolver consistently improves end-to-end task success, with an average gain of 12\% across multiple LLM backbones, demonstrating that EO expertise can emerge progressively from efficient, fine-grained interactions with the environment.

AI.tldr: GeoEvolver是一个多智能体系统，通过结构化交互使LLM智能体能够习得地球观测（EO）领域的专业知识，无需参数更新，从而提高了复杂EO任务的端到端成功率。
AI.motivation: 现有的LLM智能体在需要长期执行、跨模态协调和遵守隐式工具约束的专业领域（如地球观测）中存在困难，因为它们缺乏从交互中学习细粒度工具级专业知识的机制。
AI.method: GeoEvolver采用自演化多智能体系统（MAS），通过检索增强的多智能体协调器将查询分解为子目标，并在子目标层面探索多样化的工具-参数配置。成功模式和失败的根本原因归因被提炼到一个演化内存库中，为未来的查询提供上下文演示。
AI.result: 在三个集成工具的EO基准测试上进行实验，GeoEvolver在多种LLM骨干上平均提高了12%的任务成功率，表明EO专业知识可以从与环境的精细交互中逐步涌现。
AI.conclusion: GeoEvolver能够有效地使LLM智能体获得EO专业知识，从而克服了现有智能体在复杂、工具密集型领域面临的挑战，并提高了任务的成功率。

title: STEMVerse: A Dual-Axis Diagnostic Framework for STEM Reasoning in Large Language Models
summary: As Large Language Models (LLMs) achieve significant breakthroughs in complex reasoning tasks, evaluating their proficiency in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) has become a primary method for measuring machine intelligence. However, current evaluation paradigms often treat benchmarks as isolated "silos," offering only monolithic aggregate scores that neglect the intricacies of both academic specialization and cognitive depth. This result-oriented approach fails to distinguish whether model errors stem from insufficient domain knowledge or deficiencies in cognitive capacity, thereby limiting the diagnostic value. To address this, we propose STEMVerse, a diagnostic framework designed to systematically analyze the STEM reasoning capabilities of LLMs. This framework characterizes model performance across academic specialization and cognitive complexity to map the capability required for reasoning. We re-aggregate over 20,000 STEM problems from mainstream benchmarks into a unified "Discipline $\times$ Cognition" capability space, assigning dual-axis labels to every instance. Utilizing this unified diagnostic framework, we systematically evaluate representative LLM families across varying parameter scales and training paradigms. Our empirical results reveal structural failure patterns in STEM reasoning. By integrating multi-disciplinary coverage and fine-grained cognitive stratification into a unified framework, STEMVerse provides a clear and actionable perspective for understanding the scientific reasoning characteristics of LLMs.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了STEMVerse，一个旨在系统性分析大型语言模型（LLMs）在科学、技术、工程和数学（STEM）领域推理能力的新型诊断框架。该框架通过将学术专业化和认知复杂度结合起来，对超过20,000个STEM问题进行重新组织和标记，从而克服了现有评估方法忽略领域知识和认知能力区别的局限性。
AI.motivation: 现有的LLM评估方法往往将STEM基准视为独立的“筒仓”，只提供单一的总体分数，忽略了学术专业化和认知深度的复杂性。这种结果导向的方法无法区分模型错误是源于领域知识不足还是认知能力缺陷，从而限制了诊断价值。因此，需要一个更精细的框架来系统分析LLMs的STEM推理能力。
AI.method: 研究提出了STEMVerse框架，该框架将学术专业化和认知复杂度相结合，创建一个“学科 × 认知”的二元能力空间。研究者将主流基准中的20,000多个STEM问题重新整合到这个空间中，并为每个问题分配了双轴标签。然后，利用STEMVerse框架对不同参数规模和训练范式的代表性LLM家族进行系统性评估。
AI.result: 通过STEMVerse框架的系统评估，研究揭示了LLMs在STEM推理中存在的结构性失败模式。该框架能够区分模型在不同学科领域和不同认知复杂度下的表现差异。
AI.conclusion: STEMVerse提供了一个清晰且可操作的视角来理解LLMs的科学推理特征。通过将多学科覆盖和细粒度的认知分层整合到一个统一的框架中，STEMVerse能够更准确地诊断LLMs在STEM领域的优势和劣势，并指导未来的模型改进。

title: AROLA: A Modular Layered Architecture for Scaled Autonomous Racing
summary: Autonomous racing has advanced rapidly, particularly on scaled platforms, and software stacks must evolve accordingly. In this work, AROLA is introduced as a modular, layered software architecture in which fragmented and monolithic designs are reorganized into interchangeable layers and components connected through standardized ROS 2 interfaces. The autonomous-driving pipeline is decomposed into sensing, pre-processing, perception, localization and mapping, planning, behavior, control, and actuation, enabling rapid module replacement and objective benchmarking without reliance on custom message definitions. To support consistent performance evaluation, a Race Monitor framework is introduced as a lightweight system through which lap timing, trajectory quality, and computational load are logged in real time and standardized post-race analyses are generated. AROLA is validated in simulation and on hardware using the RoboRacer platform, including deployment at the 2025 RoboRacer IV25 competition. Together, AROLA and Race Monitor demonstrate that modularity, transparent interfaces, and systematic evaluation can accelerate development and improve reproducibility in scaled autonomous racing.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了AROLA，一个模块化的分层软件架构，用于自主赛车，并引入了Race Monitor框架以进行标准化评估，旨在加速开发和提高可重现性。
AI.motivation: 为了应对自主赛车快速发展的需求，现有的软件栈需要进化，以支持更快的模块替换和客观的基准测试，同时提高开发的可重现性。
AI.method: AROLA将自动驾驶流水线分解为感应、预处理、感知、定位与建图、规划、行为、控制和执行等模块，并通过ROS 2接口连接。Race Monitor框架用于实时记录和生成标准化赛后分析，包括圈速、轨迹质量和计算负载。
AI.result: AROLA架构在模拟和RoboRacer硬件平台上得到了验证，并在2025 RoboRacer IV25竞赛中部署。模块化、透明的接口和系统化的评估能够加速开发。
AI.conclusion: AROLA软件架构和Race Monitor框架的结合，证明了模块化、透明的接口和系统化的评估方法可以有效加速小型自主赛车领域的开发进程，并提高研究结果的可重现性。

title: SVD-ViT: Does SVD Make Vision Transformers Attend More to the Foreground?
summary: Vision Transformers (ViT) have been established as large-scale foundation models. However, because self-attention operates globally, they lack an explicit mechanism to distinguish foreground from background. As a result, ViT may learn unnecessary background features and artifacts, leading to degraded classification performance. To address this issue, we propose SVD-ViT, which leverages singular value decomposition (SVD) to prioritize the learning of foreground features. SVD-ViT consists of three components-\textbf{SPC module}, \textbf{SSVA}, and \textbf{ID-RSVD}-and suppresses task-irrelevant factors such as background noise and artifacts by extracting and aggregating singular vectors that capture object foreground information. Experimental results demonstrate that our method improves classification accuracy and effectively learns informative foreground representations while reducing the impact of background noise.

AI.tldr: 本文提出SVD-ViT，一种利用奇异值分解（SVD）来增强Vision Transformer（ViT）在区分前景和背景方面的能力的模型，从而提高分类性能。
AI.motivation: Vision Transformers（ViT）缺乏区分前景和背景的机制，可能导致学习不必要的背景特征和伪影，从而降低分类性能。
AI.method: 提出SVD-ViT，包含SPC模块、SSVA和ID-RSVD三个组件，利用奇异值分解提取和聚合捕获前景信息的奇异向量，以抑制任务无关的背景噪声和伪影。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，SVD-ViT提高了分类准确性，有效学习了信息丰富的前景表示，并减少了背景噪声的影响。
AI.conclusion: SVD-ViT通过引入基于SVD的前景特征提取机制，能够克服ViT在处理包含背景噪声和伪影的图像时的局限性，实现更好的图像分类性能。

title: PokeNet: Learning Kinematic Models of Articulated Objects from Human Observations
summary: Articulation modeling enables robots to learn joint parameters of articulated objects for effective manipulation which can then be used downstream for skill learning or planning. Existing approaches often rely on prior knowledge about the objects, such as the number or type of joints. Some of these approaches also fail to recover occluded joints that are only revealed during interaction. Others require large numbers of multi-view images for every object, which is impractical in real-world settings. Furthermore, prior works neglect the order of manipulations, which is essential for many multi-DoF objects where one joint must be operated before another, such as a dishwasher. We introduce PokeNet, an end-to-end framework that estimates articulation models from a single human demonstration without prior object knowledge. Given a sequence of point cloud observations of a human manipulating an unknown object, PokeNet predicts joint parameters, infers manipulation order, and tracks joint states over time. PokeNet outperforms existing state-of-the-art methods, improving joint axis and state estimation accuracy by an average of over 27% across diverse objects, including novel and unseen categories. We demonstrate these gains in both simulation and real-world environments.

AI.tldr: PokeNet是一个无需先验知识即可从单个人类演示中学习物体关节模型（包括运动顺序）的端到端框架，在关节轴和状态估计方面比现有方法有显著改进。
AI.motivation: 现有机器人关节建模方法依赖先验知识，无法处理被遮挡的关节，需要大量多视图图像，并且忽略了对多自由度物体至关重要的操作顺序。
AI.method: PokeNet是一个端到端框架，接收人类操纵未知物体点云序列的观察，预测关节参数、推断操作顺序并跟踪关节状态。
AI.result: PokeNet在关节轴和状态估计方面比现有最先进方法平均提高了27%以上，在模拟和现实世界环境中均表现出色，包括新颖和未见的物体类别。
AI.conclusion: PokeNet能够从单个人类演示中有效学习未知物体的关节模型，包括操作顺序，解决了现有方法的局限性，并在机器人操作和规划中具有潜在应用价值。

title: Test-Time Detoxification without Training or Learning Anything
summary: Large language models can produce toxic or inappropriate text even for benign inputs, creating risks when deployed at scale. Detoxification is therefore important for safety and user trust, particularly when we want to reduce harmful content without sacrificing the model's generation quality. Many existing approaches rely on model retraining, gradients, or learned auxiliary components, which can be costly and may not transfer across model families or to truly black-box settings. We introduce a test-time procedure that approximates the gradient of completion toxicity with respect to the input embeddings and uses a small number of descent steps to steer generation toward less toxic continuations. This is achieved with zeroth-order optimization that requires only access to input embeddings, a toxicity scoring function, and forward evaluations of the model. Empirically, the approach delivers robust toxicity reductions across models and prompts and, in most settings, achieves the best overall toxicity-quality trade-off. More broadly, our work positions word embeddings as effective control variables and encourages wider use of black-box optimization to guide autoregressive language models toward scalable, safer text generation, without requiring any training or access to intermediate computations.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种在测试时通过零阶优化来降低大型语言模型生成文本毒性的方法，该方法无需模型重训练或访问模型内部参数，并在毒性降低和生成质量之间取得了良好的权衡。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型可能生成有毒或不当内容，存在安全风险。现有的去毒化方法通常需要昂贵的模型重训练或复杂的辅助组件，并且可能难以跨模型家族或在黑盒设置下转移。因此，需要一种高效且通用的去毒化方法。
AI.method: 提出了一种在测试时进行的程序，该程序通过逼近完成毒性相对于输入嵌入的梯度，并使用少量梯度下降步骤来引导生成过程，使其产生毒性更低的续写。该方法采用零阶优化，仅需要输入嵌入、毒性评分函数以及模型的正向评估。
AI.result: 该方法在不同模型和提示下都能稳健地降低毒性，并且在大多数情况下，在毒性降低和生成质量之间实现了最佳的权衡。
AI.conclusion: 词嵌入可以作为有效的控制变量来引导语言模型生成更安全的文本。黑盒优化是一种可行的、无需训练或访问中间计算的、用于指导自回归语言模型进行可扩展、更安全文本生成的方法。

title: Impact of Physics-Informed Features on Neural Network Complexity for Li-ion Battery Voltage Prediction in Electric Vertical Takeoff and Landing Aircrafts
summary: The electrification of vertical takeoff and landing aircraft demands high-fidelity battery management systems capable of predicting voltage response under aggressive power dynamics. While data-driven models offer high accuracy, they often require complex architectures and extensive training data. Conversely, equivalent circuit models (ECMs), such as the second-order model, offer physical interpretability but struggle with high C-rate non-linearities. This paper investigates the impact of integrating physics-based information into data-driven surrogate models. Specifically, we evaluate whether physics-informed features allow for the simplification of neural network architectures without compromising accuracy. Using the open-source electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) battery dataset, we compare pure data-driven models against physics-informed data models. Results demonstrate that physics-informed models achieve comparable accuracy to complex pure data-driven models while using up to 75% fewer trainable parameters, significantly reducing computational overhead for potential on-board deployment.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合物理信息的数据驱动模型，用于管理电动垂直起降（eVTOL）飞机的电池系统。该模型在保持高精度的同时，大大减少了所需的可训练参数数量，降低了计算开销。
AI.motivation: 为满足电动垂直起降（eVTOL）飞机高精度的电池管理系统需求，同时解决现有数据驱动模型复杂和需要大量训练数据，以及等效电路模型（ECM）在高倍率非线性方面不足的问题。
AI.method: 通过将物理信息集成到数据驱动的代理模型中，并使用开源eVTOL电池数据集，比较了纯数据驱动模型与物理信息数据模型。评估了物理信息特征是否能简化神经网络架构而不牺牲精度。
AI.result: 物理信息模型在准确性上可与复杂的纯数据驱动模型相媲美，但可训练参数数量减少高达75%，显著降低了计算开销。
AI.conclusion: 将物理信息集成到数据驱动模型中，可以在不牺牲准确性的前提下，显著简化神经网络架构，减少计算资源需求，为在板部署提供了可行性。

title: Uncertainty and Fairness Awareness in LLM-Based Recommendation Systems
comment: Accepted at the Second Conference of the International Association for Safe and Ethical Artificial Intelligence, IASEAI26, 14 pages
summary: Large language models (LLMs) enable powerful zero-shot recommendations by leveraging broad contextual knowledge, yet predictive uncertainty and embedded biases threaten reliability and fairness. This paper studies how uncertainty and fairness evaluations affect the accuracy, consistency, and trustworthiness of LLM-generated recommendations. We introduce a benchmark of curated metrics and a dataset annotated for eight demographic attributes (31 categorical values) across two domains: movies and music. Through in-depth case studies, we quantify predictive uncertainty (via entropy) and demonstrate that Google DeepMind's Gemini 1.5 Flash exhibits systematic unfairness for certain sensitive attributes; measured similarity-based gaps are SNSR at 0.1363 and SNSV at 0.0507. These disparities persist under prompt perturbations such as typographical errors and multilingual inputs. We further integrate personality-aware fairness into the RecLLM evaluation pipeline to reveal personality-linked bias patterns and expose trade-offs between personalization and group fairness. We propose a novel uncertainty-aware evaluation methodology for RecLLMs, present empirical insights from deep uncertainty case studies, and introduce a personality profile-informed fairness benchmark that advances explainability and equity in LLM recommendations. Together, these contributions establish a foundation for safer, more interpretable RecLLMs and motivate future work on multi-model benchmarks and adaptive calibration for trustworthy deployment.

AI.tldr: 该研究评估了大型语言模型（LLMs）在推荐系统中的预测不确定性和公平性问题，提出了新的评估指标和数据集，并发现Gemini 1.5 Flash存在系统性不公平现象，尤其是在涉及敏感属性和个性化时。研究还提出了一种不确定性感知评估方法，以提高LLM推荐的可解释性和公平性。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）虽然在零样本推荐方面表现出色，但其预测不确定性和潜在的偏见会影响推荐的可靠性和公平性。因此，本研究旨在评估和理解不确定性及公平性评估对LLM推荐准确性、一致性和可信度的影响。
AI.method: 研究构建了一个包含精心设计的度量指标的基准，并创建了一个包含八个人口统计学属性（31个类别值）的跨电影和音乐领域的标注数据集。通过案例研究量化预测不确定性（通过熵），并分析了在提示扰动（如拼写错误和多语言输入）下不公平现象的持续性。此外，研究将人格感知公平性整合到RecLLM评估流程中，并提出了一种新颖的不确定性感知评估方法。
AI.result: 研究发现，Google DeepMind的Gemini 1.5 Flash在某些敏感属性上存在系统性不公平现象，相似度差距测量显示SNSR为0.1363，SNSV为0.0507。这些差异在提示扰动下依然存在。人格感知公平性评估揭示了与人格相关的偏见模式，并暴露了个性化与群体公平性之间的权衡。
AI.conclusion: 该研究通过不确定性感知评估方法、深度不确定性案例研究以及人格画像驱动的公平性基准，为构建更安全、更具可解释性的RecLLMs奠定了基础。研究结果强调了在LLM推荐系统中解决不确定性和公平性问题的必要性，并为未来的多模型基准和自适应校准提供了方向。

title: HypCBC: Domain-Invariant Hyperbolic Cross-Branch Consistency for Generalizable Medical Image Analysis
comment: Accepted to Transactions on Machine Learning Research (TMLR)
summary: Robust generalization beyond training distributions remains a critical challenge for deep neural networks. This is especially pronounced in medical image analysis, where data is often scarce and covariate shifts arise from different hardware devices, imaging protocols, and heterogeneous patient populations. These factors collectively hinder reliable performance and slow down clinical adoption. Despite recent progress, existing learning paradigms primarily rely on the Euclidean manifold, whose flat geometry fails to capture the complex, hierarchical structures present in clinical data. In this work, we exploit the advantages of hyperbolic manifolds to model complex data characteristics. We present the first comprehensive validation of hyperbolic representation learning for medical image analysis and demonstrate statistically significant gains across eleven in-distribution datasets and three ViT models. We further propose an unsupervised, domain-invariant hyperbolic cross-branch consistency constraint. Extensive experiments confirm that our proposed method promotes domain-invariant features and outperforms state-of-the-art Euclidean methods by an average of $+2.1\%$ AUC on three domain generalization benchmarks: Fitzpatrick17k, Camelyon17-WILDS, and a cross-dataset setup for retinal imaging. These datasets span different imaging modalities, data sizes, and label granularities, confirming generalization capabilities across substantially different conditions. The code is available at https://github.com/francescodisalvo05/hyperbolic-cross-branch-consistency .

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种利用双曲流形（hyperbolic manifolds）来改善医学图像分析中深度学习模型泛化能力的方法，通过一种无监督、领域不变的双曲交叉分支一致性约束，在多个数据集和模型上取得了显著的性能提升，平均AUC提高了2.1%。
AI.motivation: 深度神经网络在医学图像分析中存在泛化能力不足的挑战，尤其是在数据稀缺和存在协变量漂移（如不同设备、成像协议、患者异质性）的情况下。现有的基于欧氏流形的方法无法有效捕捉临床数据复杂的层级结构。
AI.method: 利用双曲流形的优势来建模数据特征，并提出了一种无监督、领域不变的双曲交叉分支一致性约束。该方法在三个领域泛化基准数据集上进行了广泛验证，并使用了三种Vision Transformer (ViT) 模型。
AI.result: 所提出的方法在11个分布内数据集和3个领域泛化基准（Fitzpatrick17k, Camelyon17-WILDS, 视网膜成像跨数据集设置）上，相比于最先进的欧氏方法，平均AUC提升了2.1%。实验结果表明，该方法能够促进领域不变特征的学习。
AI.conclusion: 双曲表示学习能够有效提升医学图像分析的泛化能力，并且所提出的无监督、领域不变的双曲交叉分支一致性约束是一种有效的促进领域不变特征学习的方法，能够克服欧氏方法的局限性，并在跨不同成像模态、数据大小和标签粒度的数据集上实现优越的泛化性能。

title: ROSA-Tuning: Enhancing Long-Context Modeling via Suffix Matching
summary: Long-context capability and computational efficiency are among the central challenges facing today's large language models. Existing efficient attention methods reduce computational complexity, but they typically suffer from a limited coverage of the model state. This paper proposes ROSA-Tuning, a retrieval-and-recall mechanism for enhancing the long-context modeling ability of pretrained models. Beyond the standard attention mechanism, ROSA-Tuning introduces in parallel a CPU-based ROSA (RWKV Online Suffix Automaton) retrieval module, which efficiently locates historical positions in long contexts that are relevant to the current query, and injects the retrieved information into the model state in a trainable manner; subsequent weighted fusion can then be handled by range-restricted attention. To enable end-to-end training, we design a binary discretization strategy and a counterfactual gradient algorithm, and further optimize overall execution efficiency via an asynchronous CPU-GPU pipeline. Systematic evaluations on Qwen3-Base-1.7B show that ROSA-Tuning substantially restores the long-context modeling ability of windowed-attention models, achieving performance close to and in some cases matching global attention on benchmarks such as LongBench, while maintaining computational efficiency and GPU memory usage that are nearly comparable to windowed-attention methods, offering a new technical path for efficient long-context processing. The example code can be found at https://github.com/zyaaa-ux/ROSA-Tuning.

AI.tldr: ROSA-Tuning 提出了一种结合检索和召回的新机制，通过 CPU 上的 ROSA 模块高效定位历史相关信息并注入模型状态，以增强预训练模型在长上下文场景下的建模能力，同时保持接近窗口注意力机制的计算效率和显存占用。
AI.motivation: 当前大型语言模型在长上下文处理能力和计算效率方面面临挑战。现有的高效注意力机制通常会限制模型状态的覆盖范围，ROSA-Tuning 旨在解决这一问题。
AI.method: ROSA-Tuning 引入了一个基于 CPU 的 ROSA (RWKV Online Suffix Automaton) 检索模块，并行于标准注意力机制，用于高效查找长上下文中的相关历史位置，并以可训练的方式将检索到的信息注入模型状态。后续通过受限范围的注意力机制进行加权融合。为实现端到端训练，设计了二值化策略和反事实梯度算法，并通过异步 CPU-GPU 流水线优化执行效率。
AI.result: 在 Qwen3-Base-1.7B 模型上进行评估，ROSA-Tuning 显著恢复了窗口注意力模型的长上下文建模能力，在 LongBench 等基准测试上取得了接近甚至媲美全局注意力的性能，同时计算效率和 GPU 显存占用接近窗口注意力方法。
AI.conclusion: ROSA-Tuning 提供了一种高效处理长上下文的新技术路径，能够在保持计算效率的同时，显著提升模型在长序列任务上的性能。

title: LEVIO: Lightweight Embedded Visual Inertial Odometry for Resource-Constrained Devices
comment: This article has been accepted for publication in the IEEE Sensors Journal (JSEN)
summary: Accurate, infrastructure-less sensor systems for motion tracking are essential for mobile robotics and augmented reality (AR) applications. The most popular state-of-the-art visual-inertial odometry (VIO) systems, however, are too computationally demanding for resource-constrained hardware, such as micro-drones and smart glasses. This work presents LEVIO, a fully featured VIO pipeline optimized for ultra-low-power compute platforms, allowing six-degrees-of-freedom (DoF) real-time sensing. LEVIO incorporates established VIO components such as Oriented FAST and Rotated BRIEF (ORB) feature tracking and bundle adjustment, while emphasizing a computationally efficient architecture with parallelization and low memory usage to suit embedded microcontrollers and low-power systems-on-chip (SoCs). The paper proposes and details the algorithmic design choices and the hardware-software co-optimization approach, and presents real-time performance on resource-constrained hardware. LEVIO is validated on a parallel-processing ultra-low-power RISC-V SoC, achieving 20 FPS while consuming less than 100 mW, and benchmarked against public VIO datasets, offering a compelling balance between efficiency and accuracy. To facilitate reproducibility and adoption, the complete implementation is released as open-source.

AI.tldr: LEVIO 是一种针对低功耗计算平台优化的视觉-惯性里程计 (VIO) 系统，实现了六自由度实时感知，并以开源形式发布。
AI.motivation: 现有的 VIO 系统计算成本过高，不适用于微型无人机和智能眼镜等资源受限的硬件。
AI.method: LEVIO 整合了 ORB 特征跟踪和捆绑调整等现有 VIO 组件，并采用计算高效的架构，通过并行化和低内存使用来实现低功耗。
AI.result: LEVIO 在低功耗 RISC-V SoC 上实现了 20 FPS 的实时性能，功耗低于 100 mW，并在公开数据集上进行了验证，取得了效率和精度的良好平衡。
AI.conclusion: LEVIO 是一种高效且准确的 VIO 系统，适用于资源受限的嵌入式平台，为移动机器人和 AR 应用提供了可行的解决方案。

title: PeerRank: Autonomous LLM Evaluation Through Web-Grounded, Bias-Controlled Peer Review
summary: Evaluating large language models typically relies on human-authored benchmarks, reference answers, and human or single-model judgments, approaches that scale poorly, become quickly outdated, and mismatch open-world deployments that depend on web retrieval and synthesis. We introduce PeerRank, a fully autonomous end-to-end evaluation framework in which models generate evaluation tasks, answer them with category-scoped live web grounding, judge peer responses and aggregate dense peer assessments into relative performance estimates, without human supervision or gold references. PeerRank treats evaluation as a multi-agent process where each model participates symmetrically as task designer, respondent, and evaluator, while removing biased judgments. In a large-scale study over 12 commercially available models and 420 autonomously generated questions, PeerRank produces stable, discriminative rankings and reveals measurable identity and presentation biases. Rankings are robust, and mean peer scores agree with Elo. We further validate PeerRank on TruthfulQA and GSM8K, where peer scores correlate with objective accuracy. Together, these results suggest that bias-aware peer evaluation with selective web-grounded answering can scale open-world LLM assessment beyond static and human curated benchmarks.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为PeerRank的全自动化、端到端的LLM评估框架，该框架无需人工干预或参考答案，通过多智能体协作（模型作为任务设计者、回答者和评估者）来评估大型语言模型，并在大规模实验中展示了其稳定性和有效性。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM评估方法（如人工编写的基准测试、参考答案和人工/单一模型评分）存在可扩展性差、过时快以及与实际在线部署不匹配的问题。需要一种能够适应开放世界部署、可扩展且不受人类偏见影响的LLM评估方法。
AI.method: PeerRank框架将评估视为一个多智能体过程。模型自主生成评估任务，利用网络实时信息进行回答，并评估其他模型的响应。最后，将密集的同行评估汇总成相对性能估计。所有模型在任务设计、回答和评估方面都对称参与，以消除偏见。
AI.result: 在一项涉及12个商业模型和420个自动生成问题的研究中，PeerRank生成了稳定且有区分度的排名，并揭示了可衡量的身份和呈现偏见。排名具有鲁棒性，平均同行得分与Elo评分一致。在TruthfulQA和GSM8K数据集上的验证结果显示，同行得分与客观准确率相关。
AI.conclusion: PeerRank是一种能够摆脱静态和人工策划基准测试的、可扩展的开放世界LLM评估方法。通过结合偏见感知型同行评估和选择性的网络检索式回答，可以更有效地评估大型语言模型。

title: Power Reserve Procurement Considering Dependent Random Variables with PCE
summary: This paper presents an approach for the modelling of dependent random variables using generalised polynomial chaos. This allows to write chance-constrained optimization problems with respect to a joint distribution modelling dependencies between different stochastic inputs. Arbitrary dependencies are modelled by using Gaussian copulas to construct the joint distribution. The paper exploits the problem structure and develops suitable transformations to ensure tractability. The proposed method is applied to a probabilistic power reserve procurement problem. The effectiveness of the method to capture dependencies is shown by comparing the approach with a standard approach considering independent random variables.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了一种使用广义多项式混沌来模拟相关随机变量的方法，并将其应用于概率性电力储备采购问题，通过考虑依赖关系来提高优化问题的可处理性和准确性。
AI.motivation: 现有的优化方法通常假设随机输入变量是独立的，这在许多实际应用中是不准确的，导致模型不精确。需要一种方法来对随机输入变量之间的依赖关系进行建模，以便更准确地解决机会约束优化问题。
AI.method: 该方法利用广义多项式混沌来建模随机变量的联合分布，并通过高斯 copula 来捕捉任意依赖关系。为了保证算法的可处理性，研究者利用了问题的结构并开发了相应的变换。最后，将该方法应用于概率性电力储备采购问题，并与考虑独立随机变量的标准方法进行比较。
AI.result: 通过将该方法应用于概率性电力储备采购问题，并与考虑独立随机变量的标准方法进行比较，证明了该方法能够有效地捕捉变量之间的依赖关系，从而提高优化结果的准确性。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的基于广义多项式混沌和高斯 copula 的方法能够有效地对相关随机变量进行建模，并能将这种依赖关系纳入机会约束优化问题中，从而获得比独立变量假设更精确的解决方案。该方法在概率性电力储备采购问题中得到了验证。

title: LmPT: Conditional Point Transformer for Anatomical Landmark Detection on 3D Point Clouds
comment: This paper has been accepted at International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI) 2026
summary: Accurate identification of anatomical landmarks is crucial for various medical applications. Traditional manual landmarking is time-consuming and prone to inter-observer variability, while rule-based methods are often tailored to specific geometries or limited sets of landmarks. In recent years, anatomical surfaces have been effectively represented as point clouds, which are lightweight structures composed of spatial coordinates. Following this strategy and to overcome the limitations of existing landmarking techniques, we propose Landmark Point Transformer (LmPT), a method for automatic anatomical landmark detection on point clouds that can leverage homologous bones from different species for translational research. The LmPT model incorporates a conditioning mechanism that enables adaptability to different input types to conduct cross-species learning. We focus the evaluation of our approach on femoral landmarking using both human and newly annotated dog femurs, demonstrating its generalization and effectiveness across species. The code and dog femur dataset will be publicly available at: https://github.com/Pierreoo/LandmarkPointTransformer.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为Landmark Point Transformer (LmPT) 的方法，用于在点云数据上自动检测解剖标志点，并实现了跨物种学习能力，适用于转化研究。
AI.motivation: 传统的解剖标志点标注方法耗时且存在观察者间差异，基于规则的方法通用性有限。需要一种更准确、更高效、更具适应性的自动标注方法，尤其是在跨物种研究中。
AI.method: 提出Landmark Point Transformer (LmPT) 模型，该模型利用点云表示解剖表面，并包含一个条件机制，使其能够适应不同输入类型，实现跨物种学习。在人体和犬股骨数据上进行了评估。
AI.result: LmPT在人体和犬股骨的解剖标志点检测上表现出泛化能力和有效性，证明了其跨物种学习的潜力。
AI.conclusion: LmPT是一种有效的自动解剖标志点检测方法，通过引入跨物种学习能力，为转化研究提供了新的可能性。该方法具有良好的泛化性和适应性。

title: Bimanual High-Density EMG Control for In-Home Mobile Manipulation by a User with Quadriplegia
summary: Mobile manipulators in the home can enable people with cervical spinal cord injury (cSCI) to perform daily physical household tasks that they could not otherwise do themselves. However, paralysis in these users often limits access to traditional robot control interfaces such as joysticks or keyboards. In this work, we introduce and deploy the first system that enables a user with quadriplegia to control a mobile manipulator in their own home using bimanual high-density electromyography (HDEMG). We develop a pair of custom, fabric-integrated HDEMG forearm sleeves, worn on both arms, that capture residual neuromotor activity from clinically paralyzed degrees of freedom and support real-time gesture-based robot control. Second, by integrating vision, language, and motion planning modules, we introduce a shared autonomy framework that supports robust and user-driven teleoperation, with particular benefits for navigation-intensive tasks in home environments. Finally, to demonstrate the system in the wild, we present a twelve-day in-home user study evaluating real-time use of the wearable EMG interface for daily robot control. Together, these system components enable effective robot control for performing activities of daily living and other household tasks in a real home environment.

AI.tldr: 该研究开发了一个创新的系统，允许四肢瘫痪的用户通过佩戴集成HDEMG传感器的前臂套来控制家中的移动机械臂，实现了用户驱动的共享自主操作，并成功进行了为期十二天的在家庭环境中的真实场景评估。
AI.motivation: 脊髓损伤（cSCI）用户，特别是四肢瘫痪者，由于肢体麻痹，难以使用传统的机器人控制界面来执行家务。因此，需要开发新的控制方法来增强他们的独立性。
AI.method: 研究人员开发了一对集成HDEMG传感器的织物前臂套，用于捕捉残余神经肌肉活动。该系统集成了视觉、语言和运动规划模块，构建了一个共享自主框架，支持用户通过手势进行机器人遥操作，特别是在导航方面。
AI.result: 该系统成功实现了用户在家中通过可穿戴EMG接口实时控制移动机械臂，并能够执行日常活动和其他家务任务。
AI.conclusion: 通过结合可穿戴HDEMG技术、共享自主框架和多模态集成，该系统为四肢瘫痪用户在家中有效控制移动机械臂提供了可行的解决方案，增强了他们的自主生活能力。

title: A Positive Case for Faithfulness: LLM Self-Explanations Help Predict Model Behavior
summary: LLM self-explanations are often presented as a promising tool for AI oversight, yet their faithfulness to the model's true reasoning process is poorly understood. Existing faithfulness metrics have critical limitations, typically relying on identifying unfaithfulness via adversarial prompting or detecting reasoning errors. These methods overlook the predictive value of explanations. We introduce Normalized Simulatability Gain (NSG), a general and scalable metric based on the idea that a faithful explanation should allow an observer to learn a model's decision-making criteria, and thus better predict its behavior on related inputs. We evaluate 18 frontier proprietary and open-weight models, e.g., Gemini 3, GPT-5.2, and Claude 4.5, on 7,000 counterfactuals from popular datasets covering health, business, and ethics. We find self-explanations substantially improve prediction of model behavior (11-37% NSG). Self-explanations also provide more predictive information than explanations generated by external models, even when those models are stronger. This implies an advantage from self-knowledge that external explanation methods cannot replicate. Our approach also reveals that, across models, 5-15% of self-explanations are egregiously misleading. Despite their imperfections, we show a positive case for self-explanations: they encode information that helps predict model behavior.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为归一化可模拟增益（NSG）的新指标，用于评估大型语言模型（LLM）的自我解释是否忠实于模型的真实推理过程。研究发现，自我解释能显著提高对模型行为的预测能力，并且其信息量优于外部模型生成的解释，尽管仍有部分自我解释存在误导性。
AI.motivation: 现有评估LLM自我解释忠实性的方法存在局限性，主要依赖于对抗性提示或检测推理错误，忽略了解释的预测价值。研究旨在开发一种更通用的、可扩展的指标来量化自我解释的忠实性。
AI.method: 提出归一化可模拟增益（NSG）指标，该指标基于一个假设：忠实的解释应能帮助观察者学习模型的决策标准，从而提高对相关输入的预测能力。在18个前沿模型上，使用7000个来自健康、商业和伦理等领域的反事实样本进行评估。
AI.result: 自我解释能显著提高对模型行为的预测能力（NSG提升11%-37%）。与外部模型生成的解释相比，即使外部模型更强大，自我解释也提供了更多预测信息。研究还发现，5%-15%的自我解释存在严重误导性。
AI.conclusion: 尽管存在部分误导性的自我解释，但LLM的自我解释确实编码了有助于预测模型行为的信息，表明了其在AI监管方面的积极潜力，并且其“自我知识”优势是外部解释方法无法复制的。

title: Graph-Augmented Reasoning with Large Language Models for Tobacco Pest and Disease Management
summary: This paper proposes a graph-augmented reasoning framework for tobacco pest and disease management that integrates structured domain knowledge into large language models. Building on GraphRAG, we construct a domain-specific knowledge graph and retrieve query-relevant subgraphs to provide relational evidence during answer generation. The framework adopts ChatGLM as the Transformer backbone with LoRA-based parameter-efficient fine-tuning, and employs a graph neural network to learn node representations that capture symptom-disease-treatment dependencies. By explicitly modeling diseases, symptoms, pesticides, and control measures as linked entities, the system supports evidence-aware retrieval beyond surface-level text similarity. Retrieved graph evidence is incorporated into the LLM input to guide generation toward domain-consistent recommendations and to mitigate hallucinated or inappropriate treatments. Experimental results show consistent improvements over text-only baselines, with the largest gains observed on multi-hop and comparative reasoning questions that require chaining multiple relations.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了一个图增强的推理框架，用于烟草病虫害管理，将结构化领域知识集成到大型语言模型（LLMs）中。通过构建特定领域的知识图谱，并检索查询相关的子图，为答案生成提供关系证据。该框架使用ChatGLM作为Transformer骨干，并采用LoRA进行参数高效微调，同时利用图神经网络学习节点表示，捕捉症状-疾病-治疗依赖关系。实验结果表明，该框架在多跳和比较推理问题上优于纯文本基线。
AI.motivation: 现有的烟草病虫害管理系统在处理复杂查询和提供准确、可靠的治疗建议方面存在不足，尤其是在需要推理和整合多方面信息的情况下。作者希望通过集成结构化的领域知识来增强大型语言模型的能力，以提高回答的准确性和可靠性。
AI.method: 该研究构建了一个烟草病虫害领域的知识图谱，其中包含疾病、症状、农药和防治措施等实体及其之间的关系。在此基础上，提出了一种图增强的推理框架（GraphRAG），通过检索与查询相关的子图来提供关系证据。该框架以ChatGLM为基础模型，并使用LoRA进行参数高效微调。同时，采用图神经网络（GNN）学习节点表示，以捕捉实体间的依赖关系。检索到的图谱证据被整合到LLM的输入中，以指导生成。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，该图增强推理框架在烟草病虫害管理任务上，相比于纯文本基线，取得了持续的性能提升。尤其是在需要多步推理和比较的问题上，提升效果最为显著。
AI.conclusion: 将结构化领域知识图谱与大型语言模型相结合，能够有效地增强烟草病虫害管理系统的推理能力，生成更具证据支持和领域一致性的治疗建议，并有效减少不准确或幻觉的治疗方案。

title: Efficient Sequential Neural Network with Spatial-Temporal Attention and Linear LSTM for Robust Lane Detection Using Multi-Frame Images
comment: 14 pages, 9 figures, under review by IEEE T-ITS
summary: Lane detection is a crucial perception task for all levels of automated vehicles (AVs) and Advanced Driver Assistance Systems, particularly in mixed-traffic environments where AVs must interact with human-driven vehicles (HDVs) and challenging traffic scenarios. Current methods lack versatility in delivering accurate, robust, and real-time compatible lane detection, especially vision-based methods often neglect critical regions of the image and their spatial-temporal (ST) salience, leading to poor performance in difficult circumstances such as serious occlusion and dazzle lighting. This study introduces a novel sequential neural network model with a spatial-temporal attention mechanism to focus on key features of lane lines and exploit salient ST correlations among continuous image frames. The proposed model, built on a standard encoder-decoder structure and common neural network backbones, is trained and evaluated on three large-scale open-source datasets. Extensive experiments demonstrate the strength and robustness of the proposed model, outperforming state-of-the-art methods in various testing scenarios. Furthermore, with the ST attention mechanism, the developed sequential neural network models exhibit fewer parameters and reduced Multiply-Accumulate Operations (MACs) compared to baseline sequential models, highlighting their computational efficiency. Relevant data, code, and models are released at https://doi.org/10.4121/4619cab6-ae4a-40d5-af77-582a77f3d821.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结合空间-时间注意力机制的序列神经网络模型，用于提高自动驾驶车辆在复杂交通环境下的车道线检测精度和鲁棒性，同时降低了计算复杂度。
AI.motivation: 现有车道线检测方法在混合交通、严重遮挡和眩光等复杂场景下表现不佳，尤其是在忽略图像关键区域和时空显著性方面存在不足。
AI.method: 构建了一个基于标准编码器-解码器结构和通用神经网络骨干的序列神经网络模型，并引入了空间-时间注意力机制来聚焦车道线特征和利用连续帧之间的时空关联。
AI.result: 该模型在三个大型开源数据集上进行了训练和评估，实验结果表明其性能优于现有最先进的方法，并且在参数量和计算量方面比基线模型更具计算效率。
AI.conclusion: 提出的带有时空注意力机制的序列神经网络模型能够有效提升车道线检测的精度和鲁棒性，特别是在挑战性场景下，同时实现了更高的计算效率。

title: Dynamics of Implicit Time-Invariant Max-Min-Plus-Scaling Discrete-Event Systems
summary: Max-min-plus-scaling (MMPS) systems generalize max-plus, min-plus and max-min-plus models with more flexibility in modelling discrete-event dynamics. Especially, implicit MMPS models capture a wide range of real world discrete-event applications. This article analyzes the dynamics of an autonomous, time-invariant implicit MMPS system in a discrete-event framework. First, we provide sufficient conditions under which an implicit MMPS system admits at least one solution to its state-space representation. Then, we analyze its global behavior by determining the key parameters; the growth rates and fixed points. For a solvable MMPS system, we assess the local behavior of the system around its set of fixed points via a normalization procedure. Further, we present the notion of stability for the normalized system. A case study of the urban railway network substantiates the theoretical results.

AI.tldr: 该论文研究了自律、时不变的隐式 max-min-plus-scaling (MMPS) 系统的动力学，提供了其解的存在条件，并分析了其全局和局部行为（增长率、不动点、归一化和稳定性），通过一个城市铁路网络的案例进行了验证。
AI.motivation: 为了更灵活地模拟离散事件动力学，特别是在实际离散事件应用中，需要对隐式 MMPS 模型进行深入研究。
AI.method: 首先，提出了隐式 MMPS 系统状态空间表示解的存在条件。然后，通过确定增长率和不动点来分析系统的全局行为。接着，通过归一化过程评估了系统在不动点附近的局部行为，并引入了归一化系统的稳定性概念。
AI.result: 论文提供了隐式 MMPS 系统解的存在条件。对于可解系统，分析了其增长率、不动点、局部行为和稳定性。通过城市铁路网络的案例研究验证了理论结果。
AI.conclusion: 该研究为理解和分析隐式 MMPS 系统的动力学提供了理论框架，并展示了其在实际离散事件系统建模中的应用潜力。

title: Adaptive Linear Path Model-Based Diffusion
summary: The interest in combining model-based control approaches with diffusion models has been growing. Although we have seen many impressive robotic control results in difficult tasks, the performance of diffusion models is highly sensitive to the choice of scheduling parameters, making parameter tuning one of the most critical challenges. We introduce Linear Path Model-Based Diffusion (LP-MBD), which replaces the variance-preserving schedule with a flow-matching-inspired linear probability path. This yields a geometrically interpretable and decoupled parameterization that reduces tuning complexity and provides a stable foundation for adaptation. Building on this, we propose Adaptive LP-MBD (ALP-MBD), which leverages reinforcement learning to adjust diffusion steps and noise levels according to task complexity and environmental conditions. Across numerical studies, Brax benchmarks, and mobile-robot trajectory tracking, LP-MBD simplifies scheduling while maintaining strong performance, and ALP-MBD further improves robustness, adaptability, and real-time efficiency.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 LP-MBD 的新型基于模型的扩散模型方法，用线性概率路径取代了传统的方差保持调度，简化了参数调整并提高了稳定性。进一步提出 ALP-MBD，利用强化学习自适应调整扩散步长和噪声水平，从而增强了鲁棒性、适应性和实时效率。
AI.motivation: 现有基于扩散模型的机器人控制方法对调度参数的选择非常敏感，参数调整是主要的挑战。研究人员希望找到一种更简单、更鲁棒的方法来控制扩散模型的参数。
AI.method: 提出 LP-MBD，使用受流匹配启发的线性概率路径来代替方差保持调度。在此基础上，提出 ALP-MBD，通过强化学习自适应地调整扩散步长和噪声水平。
AI.result: LP-MBD 简化了调度并保持了良好的性能，在数值研究、Brax 基准测试和移动机器人轨迹跟踪中均表现良好。ALP-MBD 进一步提高了鲁棒性、适应性和实时效率。
AI.conclusion: LP-MBD 提供了一种更易于调整且性能强大的基于模型的扩散模型方法，而 ALP-MBD 通过强化学习实现了更优的自适应控制，适用于复杂的机器人任务。

title: Self-Supervised Uncalibrated Multi-View Video Anonymization in the Operating Room
summary: Privacy preservation is a prerequisite for using video data in Operating Room (OR) research. Effective anonymization relies on the exhaustive localization of every individual; even a single missed detection necessitates extensive manual correction. However, existing approaches face two critical scalability bottlenecks: (1) they usually require manual annotations of each new clinical site for high accuracy; (2) while multi-camera setups have been widely adopted to address single-view ambiguity, camera calibration is typically required whenever cameras are repositioned. To address these problems, we propose a novel self-supervised multi-view video anonymization framework consisting of whole-body person detection and whole-body pose estimation, without annotation or camera calibration. Our core strategy is to enhance the single-view detector by "retrieving" false negatives using temporal and multi-view context, and conducting self-supervised domain adaptation. We first run an off-the-shelf whole-body person detector in each view with a low-score threshold to gather candidate detections. Then, we retrieve the low-score false negatives that exhibit consistency with the high-score detections via tracking and self-supervised uncalibrated multi-view association. These recovered detections serve as pseudo labels to iteratively fine-tune the whole-body detector. Finally, we apply whole-body pose estimation on each detected person, and fine-tune the pose model using its own high-score predictions. Experiments on the 4D-OR dataset of simulated surgeries and our dataset of real surgeries show the effectiveness of our approach achieving over 97% recall. Moreover, we train a real-time whole-body detector using our pseudo labels, achieving comparable performance and highlighting our method's practical applicability. Code is available at https://github.com/CAMMA-public/OR_anonymization.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种无需标注和相机标定的自监督多视角手术室视频匿名化框架，通过多视角和时间上下文检索漏检的个体，并进行自监督域自适应，实现了高召回率的个体检测和姿态估计，具有实际应用潜力。
AI.motivation: 现有手术室视频匿名化方法在新临床站点需要手动标注，且多视角设置需要相机标定，存在可扩展性瓶颈，阻碍了视频数据的研究和应用。
AI.method: 提出一个自监督多视角视频匿名化框架，包含全身人员检测和全身姿态估计。核心策略是通过“检索”假阴性样本来增强单视角检测器，并进行自监督域自适应。具体步骤包括：1. 使用低置信度阈值的检测器收集候选检测；2. 通过跟踪和无标定多视角关联检索与高分检测一致的低分假阴性；3. 将检索到的检测作为伪标签迭代微调检测器；4. 对检测到的个体进行姿态估计，并用高分预测微调姿态模型。
AI.result: 在模拟和真实手术视频数据集上，该方法实现了超过 97% 的召回率。此外，使用伪标签训练的实时全身检测器性能相当，证明了方法的实用性。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的自监督多视角视频匿名化框架能够有效地在无需标注和相机标定的情况下实现高精度的个体检测和姿态估计，克服了现有方法的局限性，并具有良好的实际应用前景。

title: WideSeek: Advancing Wide Research via Multi-Agent Scaling
summary: Search intelligence is evolving from Deep Research to Wide Research, a paradigm essential for retrieving and synthesizing comprehensive information under complex constraints in parallel. However, progress in this field is impeded by the lack of dedicated benchmarks and optimization methodologies for search breadth. To address these challenges, we take a deep dive into Wide Research from two perspectives: Data Pipeline and Agent Optimization. First, we produce WideSeekBench, a General Broad Information Seeking (GBIS) benchmark constructed via a rigorous multi-phase data pipeline to ensure diversity across the target information volume, logical constraints, and domains. Second, we introduce WideSeek, a dynamic hierarchical multi-agent architecture that can autonomously fork parallel sub-agents based on task requirements. Furthermore, we design a unified training framework that linearizes multi-agent trajectories and optimizes the system using end-to-end RL. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of WideSeek and multi-agent RL, highlighting that scaling the number of agents is a promising direction for advancing the Wide Research paradigm.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了WideSeekBench基准和WideSeek多智能体系统，以解决搜索智能从深度研究转向广度研究的挑战，并验证了扩展智能体数量是推进广度研究的有效途径。
AI.motivation: 现有搜索智能研究主要关注深度，缺乏针对广度研究的基准和优化方法，限制了在复杂约束下并行检索和综合信息的能力。
AI.method: 构建了一个名为WideSeekBench的通用广度信息检索（GBIS）基准；提出了WideSeek，一个动态分层多智能体架构，能够根据任务需求自主分叉子智能体；设计了一个端到端强化学习的统一训练框架来优化系统。
AI.result: 实验证明了WideSeek和多智能体强化学习的有效性，并且表明增加智能体数量是推动广度研究范式发展的一个有前景的方向。
AI.conclusion: 该研究通过引入基准和创新的多智能体系统，为广度研究领域的发展提供了新的方法和方向，并强调了智能体数量扩展的重要性。

title: MARS: Modular Agent with Reflective Search for Automated AI Research
summary: Automating AI research differs from general software engineering due to computationally expensive evaluation (e.g., model training) and opaque performance attribution. Current LLM-based agents struggle here, often generating monolithic scripts that ignore execution costs and causal factors. We introduce MARS (Modular Agent with Reflective Search), a framework optimized for autonomous AI research. MARS relies on three pillars: (1) Budget-Aware Planning via cost-constrained Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) to explicitly balance performance with execution expense; (2) Modular Construction, employing a "Design-Decompose-Implement" pipeline to manage complex research repositories; and (3) Comparative Reflective Memory, which addresses credit assignment by analyzing solution differences to distill high-signal insights. MARS achieves state-of-the-art performance among open-source frameworks on MLE-Bench under comparable settings, maintaining competitiveness with the global leaderboard's top methods. Furthermore, the system exhibits qualitative "Aha!" moments, where 63% of all utilized lessons originate from cross-branch transfer, demonstrating that the agent effectively generalizes insights across search paths.

AI.tldr: MARS是一个优化的框架，用于自动化AI研究，通过成本感知规划、模块化构建和比较反思记忆来解决计算成本和性能归因的挑战，并在MLE-Bench上达到了最先进的性能，显示出有效的跨分支知识迁移能力。
AI.motivation: 现有的基于LLM的AI研究自动化工具难以处理计算成本高昂的评估和不透明的性能归因问题，往往生成忽略执行成本和因果因素的单一脚本。
AI.method: MARS框架包含三个核心部分：1) 预算感知规划，使用成本约束的蒙特卡洛树搜索（MCTS）来平衡性能和执行成本；2) 模块化构建，采用“设计-分解-实现”流程来管理复杂的AI研究代码库；3) 比较反思记忆，通过分析解决方案差异来解决信用分配问题，提取高信号洞察。
AI.result: MARS在MLE-Bench上取得了开源框架中的最先进性能，在可比设置下，其性能与全球排行榜上的顶尖方法相当。此外，63%的学习经验来自跨分支迁移，表明该代理能够有效地将见解泛化到不同的搜索路径。
AI.conclusion: MARS是一个有效的自动化AI研究框架，通过其预算感知规划、模块化构建和比较反思记忆机制，能够克服现有方法的局限性，并在性能和成本效益方面取得优异表现，同时展现出强大的跨领域知识迁移能力。

title: When control meets large language models: From words to dynamics
summary: While large language models (LLMs) are transforming engineering and technology through enhanced control capabilities and decision support, they are simultaneously evolving into complex dynamical systems whose behavior must be regulated. This duality highlights a reciprocal connection in which prompts support control system design while control theory helps shape prompts to achieve specific goals efficiently. In this study, we frame this emerging interconnection of LLM and control as a bidirectional continuum, from prompt design to system dynamics. First, we investigate how LLMs can advance the field of control in two distinct capacities: directly, by assisting in the design and synthesis of controllers, and indirectly, by augmenting research workflows. Second, we examine how control concepts help LLMs steer their trajectories away from undesired meanings, improving reachability and alignment via input optimization, parameter editing, and activation-level interventions. Third, we look into deeper integrations by treating LLMs as dynamic systems within a state-space framework, where their internal representations are closely linked to external control loops. Finally, we identify key challenges and outline future research directions to understand LLM behavior and develop interpretable and controllable LLMs that are as trustworthy and robust as their electromechanical counterparts, thereby ensuring they continue to support and safeguard society.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了大型语言模型（LLMs）与控制理论之间的双向互动关系，提出了一种从提示设计到系统动力学的连续体模型。研究一方面展示了LLMs如何辅助控制系统设计和研究，另一方面则研究了控制理论如何帮助LLMs优化其行为以实现特定目标。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）在工程和技术领域的应用日益广泛，但其复杂性也带来了行为调控的挑战。本研究旨在探索LLMs与控制理论之间的互惠关系，以期增强LLMs在工程应用中的可控性和鲁棒性。
AI.method: 研究方法包括：1. 探索LLMs在控制器设计和研究工作流方面的辅助作用；2. 应用控制理论概念，如输入优化、参数编辑和激活层干预，来引导LLMs的行为；3. 将LLMs视为状态空间框架下的动态系统，并将其内部表征与外部控制环路结合；4. 识别关键挑战并提出未来研究方向。
AI.result: 研究结果表明，LLMs可以作为控制系统设计的有力工具，同时控制理论也能有效指导LLMs的输出，使其更具可达性和一致性。将LLMs视为动态系统并结合控制理论，有望实现更深层次的集成。
AI.conclusion: 本研究提出了LLMs与控制理论相互促进的双向模型，并展示了如何通过控制理论增强LLMs的可控性和鲁棒性。未来的研究应专注于理解LLMs的行为，并开发可解释、可信赖且稳健的LLMs，以确保其对社会的积极贡献。

title: Language Movement Primitives: Grounding Language Models in Robot Motion
summary: Enabling robots to perform novel manipulation tasks from natural language instructions remains a fundamental challenge in robotics, despite significant progress in generalized problem solving with foundational models. Large vision and language models (VLMs) are capable of processing high-dimensional input data for visual scene and language understanding, as well as decomposing tasks into a sequence of logical steps; however, they struggle to ground those steps in embodied robot motion. On the other hand, robotics foundation models output action commands, but require in-domain fine-tuning or experience before they are able to perform novel tasks successfully. At its core, there still remains the fundamental challenge of connecting abstract task reasoning with low-level motion control. To address this disconnect, we propose Language Movement Primitives (LMPs), a framework that grounds VLM reasoning in Dynamic Movement Primitive (DMP) parameterization.
