AI.result: iDCOL框架能够提供平滑可微的接触运动学，即使在几何退化的情况下也能保持鲁棒性。通过大量的碰撞仿真和基准测试，证明了该方法的有效性。此外，在基于梯度的运动规划和可微分接触物理（包括多刚体碰撞和软体机器人交互）方面展示了其应用潜力。
AI.conclusion: iDCOL框架通过对退化几何体进行正则化，成功地实现了可微分的碰撞检测和接触运动学，克服了传统方法的局限性。该框架为机器人领域的梯度优化方法提供了更广泛的应用前景，尤其是在复杂接触场景下。

title: Task--Specificity Score: Measuring How Much Instructions Really Matter for Supervision
summary:
Instruction tuning is now the default way to train and adapt large language models, but many instruction--input--output pairs are only weakly specified: for a given input, the same output can remain plausible under several alternative instructions. This raises a simple question: \emph{does the instruction uniquely determine the target output?}
  We propose the \textbf{Task--Specificity Score (TSS)} to quantify how much an instruction matters for predicting its output, by contrasting the true instruction against plausible alternatives for the same input. We further introduce \textbf{TSS++}, which uses hard alternatives and a small quality term to mitigate easy-negative effects. Across three instruction datasets (\textsc{Alpaca}, \textsc{Dolly-15k}, \textsc{NI-20}) and three open LLMs (Gemma, Llama, Qwen), we show that selecting task-specific examples improves downstream performance under tight token budgets and complements quality-based filters such as perplexity and IFD.

AI.tldr: 研究提出任务特异性得分（TSS）及其改进版本TSS++，用于衡量指令对输出的决定程度，并通过实验证明选择任务特异性示例能提升模型在有限token预算下的下游性能。
AI.motivation: 当前的指令微调方法依赖于大量的指令-输入-输出对，但很多指令对输出的指定不够明确，一个输入可能对应多个合理的输出。这促使研究者思考：指令是否能唯一确定目标输出？
AI.method: 提出任务特异性得分（TSS）来量化指令对输出的决定程度，通过对比真实指令和同一输入下的其他合理指令。进一步提出TSS++，采用更难的负例和质量项来缓解易负例效应。
AI.result: 在Alpaca、Dolly-15k、NI-20三个数据集和Gemma、Llama、Qwen三个模型上进行实验，结果显示选择任务特异性（高TSS）的示例能够提高模型在有限token预算下的下游任务性能，并且与基于困惑度（perplexity）和IFD等质量过滤方法互补。
AI.conclusion: TSS和TSS++是衡量指令特异性的有效指标，通过筛选高特异性示例可以提升LLM的微调效率和性能，尤其是在资源受限的情况下。

title: Finding Optimal Video Moment without Training: Gaussian Boundary Optimization for Weakly Supervised Video Grounding
summary: Weakly supervised temporal video grounding aims to localize query-relevant segments in untrimmed videos using only video-sentence pairs, without requiring ground-truth segment annotations that specify exact temporal boundaries. Recent approaches tackle this task by utilizing Gaussian-based temporal proposals to represent query-relevant segments. However, their inference strategies rely on heuristic mappings from Gaussian parameters to segment boundaries, resulting in suboptimal localization performance. To address this issue, we propose Gaussian Boundary Optimization (GBO), a novel inference framework that predicts segment boundaries by solving a principled optimization problem that balances proposal coverage and segment compactness. We derive a closed-form solution for this problem and rigorously analyze the optimality conditions under varying penalty regimes. Beyond its theoretical foundations, GBO offers several practical advantages: it is training-free and compatible with both single-Gaussian and mixture-based proposal architectures. Our experiments show that GBO significantly improves localization, achieving state-of-the-art results across standard benchmarks. Extensive experiments demonstrate the efficiency and generalizability of GBO across various proposal schemes. The code is available at \href{https://github.com/sunoh-kim/gbo}{https://github.com/sunoh-kim/gbo}.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为高斯边界优化 (GBO) 的新颖推理框架，用于弱监督时间视频定位任务，该框架通过解决一个优化问题来预测视频片段的边界，从而提高定位性能。
AI.motivation: 现有方法在从高斯参数推断时间段边界时依赖启发式映射，导致局部化性能不佳。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为高斯边界优化 (GBO) 的推理框架，该框架通过解决一个优化问题来预测片段边界，该问题平衡了提案覆盖率和片段紧凑性，并推导出了封闭式解。
AI.result: GBO 在标准基准测试中显著提高了局部化性能，取得了最先进的成果，并且在不同提案方案中都显示出效率和通用性。
AI.conclusion: GBO 是一种原则性的优化框架，用于弱监督时间视频定位，它通过解决一个优化的边界预测问题，克服了现有方法的局限性，并取得了优异的性能。

title: RDT2: Exploring the Scaling Limit of UMI Data Towards Zero-Shot Cross-Embodiment Generalization
summary: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models hold promise for generalist robotics but currently struggle with data scarcity, architectural inefficiencies, and the inability to generalize across different hardware platforms. We introduce RDT2, a robotic foundation model built upon a 7B parameter VLM designed to enable zero-shot deployment on novel embodiments for open-vocabulary tasks. To achieve this, we collected one of the largest open-source robotic datasets--over 10,000 hours of demonstrations in diverse families--using an enhanced, embodiment-agnostic Universal Manipulation Interface (UMI). Our approach employs a novel three-stage training recipe that aligns discrete linguistic knowledge with continuous control via Residual Vector Quantization (RVQ), flow-matching, and distillation for real-time inference. Consequently, RDT2 becomes one of the first models that simultaneously zero-shot generalizes to unseen objects, scenes, instructions, and even robotic platforms. Besides, it outperforms state-of-the-art baselines in dexterous, long-horizon, and dynamic downstream tasks like playing table tennis. See https://rdt-robotics.github.io/rdt2/ for more information.

AI.tldr: RDT2是一个基于70亿参数的视觉-语言-动作（VLA）模型，旨在通过大规模数据集和创新的三阶段训练方法，实现机器人技术的通用性和零样本部署能力，即使在新的硬件平台上也能执行开放词汇的任务，并在复杂任务中表现出色。
AI.motivation: 现有的VLA模型在数据稀缺、架构效率低下以及跨硬件平台泛化能力不足方面存在挑战，研究者希望构建一个更通用、更易于部署的机器人基础模型。
AI.method: 文章提出RDT2模型，基于一个70亿参数的VLM。通过一个增强的、与具体硬件无关的通用操纵接口（UMI），收集了超过10,000小时的机器人演示数据。采用了一个新颖的三阶段训练方法，包括残差向量量化（RVQ）、流匹配和蒸馏，以在实时推理中将离散语言知识与连续控制对齐。
AI.result: RDT2成功地实现了对未见过的物体、场景、指令甚至机器人平台的零样本泛化。在乒乓球等灵巧、长时域和动态的下游任务中，其性能优于现有的最先进基线模型。
AI.conclusion: RDT2是首批能够同时实现对新颖环境、指令和硬件的零样本泛化，并在复杂机器人任务中取得优异表现的模型之一，为通用机器人技术的发展奠定了基础。

title: Distilling LLM Reasoning into Graph of Concept Predictors
summary: Deploying Large Language Models (LLMs) for discriminative workloads is often limited by inference latency, compute, and API costs at scale. Active distillation reduces these costs by querying an LLM oracle to train compact discriminative students, but most pipelines distill only final labels, discarding intermediate reasoning signals and offering limited diagnostics of what reasoning is missing and where errors arise. We propose Graph of Concept Predictors (GCP), a reasoning-aware active distillation framework that externalizes the teacher's decision process as a directed acyclic graph and mirrors it with modular concept predictors in the student. GCP enhances sample efficiency through a graph-aware acquisition strategy that targets uncertainty and disagreement at critical reasoning nodes. Additionally, it improves training stability and efficiency by performing targeted sub-module retraining, which attributes downstream loss to specific concept predictors and updates only the most influential modules. Experiments on eight NLP classification benchmarks demonstrate that GCP enhances performance under limited annotation budgets while yielding more interpretable and controllable training dynamics. Code is available at: https://github.com/Ziyang-Yu/GCP.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为图概念预测器 (GCP) 的主动蒸馏框架，通过将教师模型的决策过程外化为有向无环图，并辅以模块化的概念预测器，来解决部署大型语言模型进行区分性任务的推理延迟、计算和成本问题。GCP 通过图感知采集策略提高样本效率，并通过有针对性的子模块再训练提高训练稳定性和效率。
AI.motivation: 在规模化部署 LLM 进行区分性工作负载时，推理延迟、计算资源和 API 成本是一个主要限制。现有的主动蒸馏方法通常只蒸馏最终标签，忽略了中间推理信号，导致诊断不足，无法明确缺失的推理和错误的来源。
AI.method: 提出图概念预测器 (GCP) 框架。该框架将教师模型的决策过程表示为有向无环图 (DAG)，并在学生模型中镜像此结构，使用模块化的概念预测器来模仿推理过程。GCP 采用图感知采集策略，通过关注关键推理节点的不确定性和分歧来提高样本效率。此外，它通过进行有针对性的子模块再训练，将下游损失归因于特定的概念预测器，并仅更新最具影响力的模块，从而提高训练稳定性和效率。
AI.result: 在八个 NLP 分类基准测试上的实验表明，GCP 在有限的标注预算下能够提高模型性能。与现有方法相比，GCP 具有更高的样本效率，并且能够产生更具可解释性和可控性的训练动态。
AI.conclusion: GCP 是一种有效的推理感知主动蒸馏框架，通过将 LLM 的决策过程结构化为图并利用其进行主动学习和定向训练，显著提高了在区分性任务上的效率和性能，同时提供了更好的模型可解释性。

title: STAR: Similarity-guided Teacher-Assisted Refinement for Super-Tiny Function Calling Models
comment: The paper has been accepted to ICLR 2026
summary: The proliferation of Large Language Models (LLMs) in function calling is pivotal for creating advanced AI agents, yet their large scale hinders widespread adoption, necessitating transferring their capabilities into smaller ones. However, existing paradigms are often plagued by overfitting, training instability, ineffective binary rewards for multi-solution tasks, and the difficulty of synergizing techniques. We introduce STAR: Similarity-guided Teacher-Assisted Refinement, a novel holistic framework that effectively transfers LLMs' capabilities to super-tiny models. STAR consists of two core technical innovations: (1) Constrained Knowledge Distillation (CKD), a training objective that augments top-k forward KL divergence to suppress confidently incorrect predictions, ensuring training stability while preserving exploration capacity for downstream RL. STAR holistically synergizes these strategies within a cohesive training curriculum, enabling super-tiny models to achieve exceptional performance on complex function calling tasks; (2) Similarity-guided RL (Sim-RL), a RL mechanism that introduces a fine-grained, similarity-based reward. This provides a robust, continuous, and rich signal for better policy optimization by evaluating the similarity between generated outputs and the ground truth. Extensive experiments on challenging and renowned benchmarks demonstrate the effectiveness of our method. Our STAR models establish SOTA in their size classes, significantly outperforming baselines. Remarkably, our 0.6B STAR model achieves the best performance among all open models under 1B, surpassing even several well-known open models at a larger scale. STAR demonstrates a training framework that distills capabilities of LLMs into super-tiny models, paving the way for powerful, accessible, and efficient AI agents.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为STAR的整体框架，通过约束知识蒸馏（CKD）和相似性引导强化学习（Sim-RL），将大型语言模型（LLM）的能力有效迁移到超小型模型中，以解决大型模型部署困难和现有小型模型训练问题。STAR在函数调用任务上取得了SOTA性能，尤其是一个0.6B模型在1B以下模型中表现最佳。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLM）在函数调用方面潜力巨大，但其规模限制了广泛应用，因此需要将能力迁移到小型模型中。现有方法存在过拟合、训练不稳定、多解决方案任务的二元奖励无效以及技术协同困难等问题。
AI.method: STAR框架包含两项核心技术创新：1. 约束知识蒸馏（CKD）：增强top-k前向KL散度，抑制模型自信的错误预测，确保训练稳定性并保留下游强化学习（RL）的探索能力。2. 相似性引导强化学习（Sim-RL）：引入基于相似度的精细奖励信号，通过评估生成输出与真实值之间的相似性，为策略优化提供更鲁棒、连续和丰富的信号。
AI.result: 在具有挑战性的基准测试上进行了广泛实验，STAR模型在其模型尺寸级别上均达到了SOTA性能，显著优于基线方法。特别是，0.6B的STAR模型超越了所有1B以下的开放模型，甚至优于一些更大规模的知名模型。
AI.conclusion: STAR框架能够有效地将LLM的能力蒸馏到超小型模型中，解决了当前小型模型在函数调用任务上性能不足的问题，为构建强大、易于访问和高效的AI代理铺平了道路。

title: Manipulation via Force Distribution at Contact
summary: Efficient and robust trajectories play a crucial role in contact-rich manipulation, which demands accurate mod- eling of object-robot interactions. Many existing approaches rely on point contact models due to their computational effi- ciency. Simple contact models are computationally efficient but inherently limited for achieving human-like, contact-rich ma- nipulation, as they fail to capture key frictional dynamics and torque generation observed in human manipulation. This study introduces a Force-Distributed Line Contact (FDLC) model in contact-rich manipulation and compares it against conventional point contact models. A bi-level optimization framework is constructed, in which the lower-level solves an optimization problem for contact force computation, and the upper-level optimization applies iLQR for trajectory optimization. Through this framework, the limitations of point contact are demon- strated, and the benefits of the FDLC in generating efficient and robust trajectories are established. The effectiveness of the proposed approach is validated by a box rotating task, demonstrating that FDLC enables trajectories generated via non-uniform force distributions along the contact line, while requiring lower control effort and less motion of the robot.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种力分布线接触（FDLC）模型，用于解决机器人操作中点接触模型的局限性，并通过仿真和实验证明FDLC模型能够生成更高效、更鲁棒的轨迹，同时降低机器人控制和运动的需求。
AI.motivation: 现有点接触模型计算效率高，但在模拟人类操作中的摩擦动力学和力矩生成方面存在不足，限制了实现类人、富接触操作的机器人能力。研究旨在克服这些局限性。
AI.method: 提出了一种力分布线接触（FDLC）模型，并构建了一个双层优化框架。下层优化用于计算接触力，上层优化使用iLQR（iterative Linear Quadratic Regulator）进行轨迹优化。将FDLC模型与传统点接触模型进行了对比。
AI.result: FDLC模型能够生成非均匀分布的接触力，从而实现更高效、更鲁棒的轨迹。相较于点接触模型，FDLC在箱体旋转任务中，需要更低的控制力矩和更小的机器人运动。
AI.conclusion: FDLC模型能够有效地捕捉富接触操作中的关键摩擦动力学，并克服点接触模型的不足，生成更高质量的机器人操作轨迹，证明了其在实际应用中的有效性。

title: Learning-based Adaptive Control of Quadruped Robots for Active Stabilization on Moving Platforms
comment: Accepted to IROS 2024. Project Page
summary: A quadruped robot faces balancing challenges on a six-degrees-of-freedom moving platform, like subways, buses, airplanes, and yachts, due to independent platform motions and resultant diverse inertia forces on the robot. To alleviate these challenges, we present the Learning-based Active Stabilization on Moving Platforms (\textit{LAS-MP}), featuring a self-balancing policy and system state estimators. The policy adaptively adjusts the robot's posture in response to the platform's motion. The estimators infer robot and platform states based on proprioceptive sensor data. For a systematic training scheme across various platform motions, we introduce platform trajectory generation and scheduling methods. Our evaluation demonstrates superior balancing performance across multiple metrics compared to three baselines. Furthermore, we conduct a detailed analysis of the \textit{LAS-MP}, including ablation studies and evaluation of the estimators, to validate the effectiveness of each component.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为LAS-MP（基于学习的主动稳定移动平台）的算法，用于解决四足机器人在六自由度运动平台上（如地铁、公交车、飞机和游艇）的平衡问题。该算法包含一个自平衡策略和系统状态估计器，并通过轨迹生成和调度方法进行训练，实验结果表明其优于基线方法。
AI.motivation: 四足机器人在地铁、公交车、飞机和游艇等六自由度运动平台上会面临平衡挑战，因为平台运动产生的惯性力会影响机器人。现有方法可能无法有效应对这些复杂动态。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为LAS-MP的算法，包含以下关键部分：1. 自平衡策略：自适应调整机器人姿态以应对平台运动。2. 系统状态估计器：利用本体感觉传感器数据估计机器人和平台的状态。3. 训练方案：引入平台轨迹生成和调度方法，以在各种平台运动下进行系统性训练。
AI.result: 在多个指标上，LAS-MP的表现优于三种基线方法。通过消融研究和对估计器的评估，验证了LAS-MP各组件的有效性。
AI.conclusion: LAS-MP算法能够有效地解决四足机器人在六自由度运动平台上的平衡问题，其自平衡策略和状态估计器在复杂动态环境下表现出色。

title: The Mask of Civility: Benchmarking Chinese Mock Politeness Comprehension in Large Language Models
summary: From a pragmatic perspective, this study systematically evaluates the differences in performance among representative large language models (LLMs) in recognizing politeness, impoliteness, and mock politeness phenomena in Chinese. Addressing the existing gaps in pragmatic comprehension, the research adopts the frameworks of Rapport Management Theory and the Model of Mock Politeness to construct a three-category dataset combining authentic and simulated Chinese discourse. Six representative models, including GPT-5.1 and DeepSeek, were selected as test subjects and evaluated under four prompting conditions: zero-shot, few-shot, knowledge-enhanced, and hybrid strategies. This study serves as a meaningful attempt within the paradigm of ``Great Linguistics,'' offering a novel approach to applying pragmatic theory in the age of technological transformation. It also responds to the contemporary question of how technology and the humanities may coexist, representing an interdisciplinary endeavor that bridges linguistic technology and humanistic reflection.

AI.tldr: 本研究在“大语言学”范式下，从语用学视角系统评估了代表性大语言模型（LLMs）在识别中文礼貌、失礼和模拟礼貌现象方面的性能差异，并提出了结合语用理论和提示工程的新方法。
AI.motivation: 现有研究在LLMs的语用理解能力方面存在不足，特别是对中文礼貌现象的识别。本研究旨在弥合这一差距，并探索技术与人文学科的融合，为“大语言学”研究提供实践案例。
AI.method: 研究构建了一个包含真实和模拟中文语料的三类数据集，涵盖礼貌、失礼和模拟礼貌。选取了包括GPT-5.1和DeepSeek在内的六个代表性LLMs，并采用零样本、少样本、知识增强和混合策略四种提示条件进行评估。
AI.result: 研究系统评估了不同LLMs在不同提示策略下的性能表现，揭示了它们在识别中文语用现象方面的差异。
AI.conclusion: 本研究为在大语言模型时代应用语用理论提供了新颖的方法，并证明了技术与人文学科的融合是可行的，为理解LLMs的语用能力提供了实证依据。

title: RC-GRPO: Reward-Conditioned Group Relative Policy Optimization for Multi-Turn Tool Calling Agents
summary: Multi-turn tool calling is challenging for Large Language Models (LLMs) because rewards are sparse and exploration is expensive. A common recipe, SFT followed by GRPO, can stall when within-group reward variation is low (e.g., more rollouts in a group receive the all 0 or all 1 reward), making the group-normalized advantage uninformative and yielding vanishing updates. To address this problem, we propose RC-GRPO (Reward-Conditioned Group Relative Policy Optimization), which treats exploration as a controllable steering problem via discrete reward tokens. We first fine-tune a Reward-Conditioned Trajectory Policy (RCTP) on mixed-quality trajectories with reward goal special tokens (e.g., <|high_reward|>, <|low_reward|>) injected into the prompts, enabling the model to learn how to generate distinct quality trajectories on demand. Then during RL, we sample diverse reward tokens within each GRPO group and condition rollouts on the sampled token to improve within-group diversity, improving advantage gains. On the Berkeley Function Calling Leaderboard v4 (BFCLv4) multi-turn benchmark, our method yields consistently improved performance than baselines, and the performance on Qwen-2.5-7B-Instruct even surpasses all closed-source API models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 RC-GRPO 的新方法，用于解决多轮工具调用中 LLM 的稀疏奖励和高昂探索成本问题，通过离散奖励令牌控制探索，并在 BFCLv4 基准测试中取得了优于基线和部分闭源模型的性能。
AI.motivation: 在多轮工具调用任务中，LLM 面临稀疏奖励和高昂探索成本的挑战。现有的 SFT+GRPO 方法在组内奖励变异性低时会停滞不前，导致策略更新无效。
AI.method: 本文提出了 RC-GRPO 方法。首先，训练一个奖励条件轨迹策略 (RCTP)，通过在提示中注入特殊奖励目标令牌（如 <|high_reward|>）来学习生成不同质量的轨迹。然后在 RL 阶段，在每个 GRPO 组内采样不同的奖励令牌，并基于采样令牌进行回放，以提高组内多样性并改善优势增益。
AI.result: 在 Berkeley Function Calling Leaderboard v4 (BFCLv4) 多轮基准测试中，RC-GRPO 的性能持续优于基线方法。特别地，使用 Qwen-2.5-7B-Instruct 模型时，性能甚至超过了所有闭源 API 模型。
AI.conclusion: RC-GRPO 通过将探索视为可控的引导问题，利用离散奖励令牌提高了 LLM 在多轮工具调用任务中的性能，有效解决了奖励稀疏和组内奖励变异性低带来的挑战。

title: ChemPro: A Progressive Chemistry Benchmark for Large Language Models
summary:
We introduce ChemPro, a progressive benchmark with 4100 natural language question-answer pairs in Chemistry, across 4 coherent sections of difficulty designed to assess the proficiency of Large Language Models (LLMs) in a broad spectrum of general chemistry topics. We include Multiple Choice Questions and Numerical Questions spread across fine-grained information recall, long-horizon reasoning, multi-concept questions, problem-solving with nuanced articulation, and straightforward questions in a balanced ratio, effectively covering Bio-Chemistry, Inorganic-Chemistry, Organic-Chemistry and Physical-Chemistry. ChemPro is carefully designed analogous to a student's academic evaluation for basic to high-school chemistry. A gradual increase in the question difficulty rigorously tests the ability of LLMs to progress from solving basic problems to solving more sophisticated challenges.
  We evaluate 45+7 state-of-the-art LLMs, spanning both open-source and proprietary variants, and our analysis reveals that while LLMs perform well on basic chemistry questions, their accuracy declines with different types and levels of complexity. These findings highlight the critical limitations of LLMs in general scientific reasoning and understanding and point towards understudied dimensions of difficulty, emphasizing the need for more robust methodologies to improve LLMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了 ChemPro，一个包含 4100 个自然语言问答对的化学领域基准测试，用于评估大型语言模型（LLMs）在通用化学知识方面的能力，并分析了当前 LLMs 在不同难度和类型化学问题上的表现。
AI.motivation: 现有 LLMs 在科学推理和理解方面的能力存在局限性，需要一个能够衡量其在不同难度和类型化学问题上表现的基准来识别这些不足。
AI.method: 构建了一个包含 4100 个问答对的 ChemPro 基准，涵盖了信息回忆、长时推理、多概念问题、细致问题解决和直接问题等，并根据难度分为 4 个部分。对 45+7 个不同类型的 LLMs 进行了评估。
AI.result: LLMs 在基础化学问题上表现良好，但随着问题的复杂性增加，准确率下降。表明 LLMs 在科学推理和理解方面存在不足，尤其是在处理更复杂和细致的问题时。
AI.conclusion: ChemPro 基准揭示了 LLMs 在通用化学推理方面的局限性，并强调了需要更强大的方法来提高 LLMs 在科学理解和解决复杂问题方面的能力。

title: Visual Reasoning over Time Series via Multi-Agent System
summary: Time series analysis underpins many real-world applications, yet existing time-series-specific methods and pretrained large-model-based approaches remain limited in integrating intuitive visual reasoning and generalizing across tasks with adaptive tool usage. To address these limitations, we propose MAS4TS, a tool-driven multi-agent system for general time series tasks, built upon an Analyzer-Reasoner-Executor paradigm that integrates agent communication, visual reasoning, and latent reconstruction within a unified framework. MAS4TS first performs visual reasoning over time series plots with structured priors using a Vision-Language Model to extract temporal structures, and subsequently reconstructs predictive trajectories in latent space. Three specialized agents coordinate via shared memory and gated communication, while a router selects task-specific tool chains for execution. Extensive experiments on multiple benchmarks demonstrate that MAS4TS achieves state-of-the-art performance across a wide range of time series tasks, while exhibiting strong generalization and efficient inference.

AI.tldr: MAS4TS是一个多智能体系统，通过视觉推理、潜在空间重构和工具链执行来解决时间序列分析任务，并在多项基准测试中取得最先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有时间序列方法和预训练大模型在整合直观的视觉推理和通过自适应工具使用进行跨任务泛化方面存在局限性。
AI.method: MAS4TS采用分析器-推理器-执行器范式，结合了智能体通信、视觉推理和潜在重构。它使用视觉语言模型进行时间序列图的视觉推理，并在潜在空间中重构预测轨迹。三个专用智能体通过共享内存和门控通信协调，并使用路由器选择任务特定的工具链进行执行。
AI.result: MAS4TS在多个基准测试上展现了在广泛时间序列任务上的最先进性能，并表现出强大的泛化能力和高效的推理能力。
AI.conclusion: MAS4TS是一个通用的、工具驱动的多智能体系统，能够有效处理时间序列任务，并通过整合视觉推理、智能体协作和自适应工具使用来克服现有方法的局限性。

title: A generalizable large-scale foundation model for musculoskeletal radiographs
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has shown promise in detecting and characterizing musculoskeletal diseases from radiographs. However, most existing models remain task-specific, annotation-dependent, and limited in generalizability across diseases and anatomical regions. Although a generalizable foundation model trained on large-scale musculoskeletal radiographs is clinically needed, publicly available datasets remain limited in size and lack sufficient diversity to enable training across a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions and anatomical sites. Here, we present SKELEX, a large-scale foundation model for musculoskeletal radiographs, trained using self-supervised learning on 1.2 million diverse, condition-rich images. The model was evaluated on 12 downstream diagnostic tasks and generally outperformed baselines in fracture detection, osteoarthritis grading, and bone tumor classification. Furthermore, SKELEX demonstrated zero-shot abnormality localization, producing error maps that identified pathologic regions without task-specific training. Building on this capability, we developed an interpretable, region-guided model for predicting bone tumors, which maintained robust performance on independent external datasets and was deployed as a publicly accessible web application. Overall, SKELEX provides a scalable, label-efficient, and generalizable AI framework for musculoskeletal imaging, establishing a foundation for both clinical translation and data-efficient research in musculoskeletal radiology.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为SKELEX的大规模基础模型，用于骨骼肌肉放射影像的分析。该模型通过自监督学习在120万张多样化的影像上进行训练，并在12项下游诊断任务中表现出色，尤其在骨折检测、骨关节炎分级和骨肿瘤分类方面优于现有方法。SKELEX还具备零样本异常定位能力，并已成功部署为网络应用，为骨骼肌肉放射影像的临床应用和研究提供了一个可扩展、标签效率高且泛化性强的AI框架。
AI.motivation: 现有的AI模型在骨骼肌肉疾病检测方面存在任务特定、依赖标注和泛化性差等问题。临床上迫切需要一个能在广泛的骨骼肌肉疾病和解剖区域上进行训练的通用基础模型，但现有公开数据集规模小且多样性不足。
AI.method: 研究人员利用自监督学习在120万张包含多种疾病的骨骼肌肉放射影像上训练了一个大规模基础模型SKELEX。随后，在12项下游诊断任务中对模型进行了评估，并开发了一个基于SKELEX能力的、可解释的、区域引导的骨肿瘤预测模型，并将其部署为网络应用。
AI.result: SKELEX模型在骨折检测、骨关节炎分级和骨肿瘤分类等任务中普遍优于基线模型。此外，SKELEX展示了零样本异常定位能力，能够识别病变区域，而无需进行特定任务的训练。其开发的骨肿瘤预测模型在独立外部数据集上表现出稳健的性能。
AI.conclusion: SKELEX为骨骼肌肉影像学提供了一个可扩展、标签效率高且泛化性强的AI框架，为临床转化和数据高效研究奠定了基础。该模型有望推动骨骼肌肉放射影像AI技术的发展和应用。

title: Gromov Wasserstein Optimal Transport for Semantic Correspondences
summary: Establishing correspondences between image pairs is a long studied problem in computer vision. With recent large-scale foundation models showing strong zero-shot performance on downstream tasks including classification and segmentation, there has been interest in using the internal feature maps of these models for the semantic correspondence task. Recent works observe that features from DINOv2 and Stable Diffusion (SD) are complementary, the former producing accurate but sparse correspondences, while the latter produces spatially consistent correspondences. As a result, current state-of-the-art methods for semantic correspondence involve combining features from both models in an ensemble. While the performance of these methods is impressive, they are computationally expensive, requiring evaluating feature maps from large-scale foundation models. In this work we take a different approach, instead replacing SD features with a superior matching algorithm which is imbued with the desirable spatial consistency property. Specifically, we replace the standard nearest neighbours matching with an optimal transport algorithm that includes a Gromov Wasserstein spatial smoothness prior. We show that we can significantly boost the performance of the DINOv2 baseline, and be competitive and sometimes surpassing state-of-the-art methods using Stable Diffusion features, while being 5--10x more efficient. We make code available at https://github.com/fsnelgar/semantic_matching_gwot .

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种新的语义匹配方法，通过将 DINOv2 特征与一种引入 Gromov Wasserstein 空间平滑先验的最优传输匹配算法相结合，取代了现有方法中计算成本较高的 Stable Diffusion 特征，在保持甚至超越当前最先进性能的同时，显著提高了效率。
AI.motivation: 现有最先进的语义匹配方法通常结合 DINOv2 和 Stable Diffusion (SD) 的特征，虽然效果好但计算成本高。本研究旨在寻找一种更有效的方法，在不牺牲性能的前提下，减少对 SD 特征的依赖。
AI.method: 将 DINOv2 特征与一种改进的匹配算法相结合。该算法用最优传输（Optimal Transport）算法取代了标准的最近邻匹配，并加入了 Gromov Wasserstein 空间平滑先验，以赋予其空间一致性。
AI.result: 所提出的方法显著提升了 DINOv2 基线的性能，并在语义匹配任务上取得了与采用 Stable Diffusion 特征的最先进方法相当甚至更优的性能，同时效率提高了 5-10 倍。
AI.conclusion: 通过将 DINOv2 特征与带有 Gromov Wasserstein 空间平滑先验的最优传输匹配算法相结合，可以实现高效且高性能的语义匹配，为该领域提供了一种有前景的替代方案。

title: PlanTRansformer: Unified Prediction and Planning with Goal-conditioned Transformer
comment: Submitted and accepted at IEEE IV 2026
summary: Trajectory prediction and planning are fundamental yet disconnected components in autonomous driving. Prediction models forecast surrounding agent motion under unknown intentions, producing multimodal distributions, while planning assumes known ego objectives and generates deterministic trajectories. This mismatch creates a critical bottleneck: prediction lacks supervision for agent intentions, while planning requires this information. Existing prediction models, despite strong benchmarking performance, often remain disconnected from planning constraints such as collision avoidance and dynamic feasibility. We introduce Plan TRansformer (PTR), a unified Gaussian Mixture Transformer framework integrating goal-conditioned prediction, dynamic feasibility, interaction awareness, and lane-level topology reasoning. A teacher-student training strategy progressively masks surrounding agent commands during training to align with inference conditions where agent intentions are unavailable. PTR achieves 4.3%/3.5% improvement in marginal/joint mAP compared to the baseline Motion Transformer (MTR) and 15.5% planning error reduction at 5s horizon compared to GameFormer. The architecture-agnostic design enables application to diverse Transformer-based prediction models. Project Website: https://github.com/SelzerConst/PlanTRansformer

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为Plan Transformer (PTR) 的统一高斯混合Transformer框架，该框架将目标条件预测、动态可行性、交互感知和车道级拓扑推理相结合，解决了自动驾驶中预测和规划脱节的问题。
AI.motivation: 当前的自动驾驶预测和规划模块是分离的，预测模型缺乏对意图的监督，而规划模型需要这些信息。现有的预测模型通常与规划约束（如避免碰撞和动态可行性）脱节。
AI.method: 引入Plan Transformer (PTR)，一个集成了目标条件预测、动态可行性、交互感知和车道级拓扑推理的统一高斯混合Transformer框架。采用师生训练策略，通过逐步掩盖周围代理的命令来使模型适应推理条件。
AI.result: PTR在边际/联合mAP上比基线Motion Transformer (MTR) 提高了4.3%/3.5%，在5秒预测范围内比GameFormer的规划误差降低了15.5%。
AI.conclusion: PTR通过一个统一的框架有效解决了预测和规划之间的不匹配问题，并能在实际应用中取得显著的性能提升。其架构无关的设计使其能够应用于各种基于Transformer的预测模型。

title: One Model, All Roles: Multi-Turn, Multi-Agent Self-Play Reinforcement Learning for Conversational Social Intelligence
summary: This paper introduces OMAR: One Model, All Roles, a reinforcement learning framework that enables AI to develop social intelligence through multi-turn, multi-agent conversational self-play. Unlike traditional paradigms that rely on static, single-turn optimizations, OMAR allows a single model to role-play all participants in a conversation simultaneously, learning to achieve long-term goals and complex social norms directly from dynamic social interaction. To ensure training stability across long dialogues, we implement a hierarchical advantage estimation that calculates turn-level and token-level advantages. Evaluations in the SOTOPIA social environment and Werewolf strategy games show that our trained models develop fine-grained, emergent social intelligence, such as empathy, persuasion, and compromise seeking, demonstrating the effectiveness of learning collaboration even under competitive scenarios. While we identify practical challenges like reward hacking, our results show that rich social intelligence can emerge without human supervision. We hope this work incentivizes further research on AI social intelligence in group conversations.

AI.tldr: OMAR是一个强化学习框架，通过多轮、多智能体的对话自玩，让AI能够扮演所有对话者，并直接从动态社交互动中学习实现长期目标和复杂社会规范，从而发展出共情、说服和寻求妥协等精细的社交智能。
AI.motivation: 传统的AI对话模型依赖于静态、单轮优化，无法有效学习长对话中的复杂社交互动和长期目标。作者希望开发一种能够让AI通过多轮、多智能体对话自玩来学习和发展社交智能的方法。
AI.method: OMAR框架允许一个模型同时扮演对话中的所有角色，通过多轮对话自玩进行训练。为了稳定训练，采用了分层优势估计（turn-level and token-level advantages）。
AI.result: 在SOTOPIA社交环境和Werewolf策略游戏中，OMAR训练出的模型展现出了精细的、涌现的社交智能，例如共情、说服和寻求妥协。研究表明，即使在竞争性场景下，AI也能有效地学习协作。
AI.conclusion: OMAR框架能够有效地让AI在没有人类监督的情况下，从动态社交互动中学习和发展出丰富的社交智能，为AI在群体对话中的社交智能研究提供了新的方向。

title: KANFIS A Neuro-Symbolic Framework for Interpretable and Uncertainty-Aware Learning
summary: Adaptive Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) was designed to combine the learning capabilities of neural network with the reasoning transparency of fuzzy logic. However, conventional ANFIS architectures suffer from structural complexity, where the product-based inference mechanism causes an exponential explosion of rules in high-dimensional spaces. We herein propose the Kolmogorov-Arnold Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (KANFIS), a compact neuro-symbolic architecture that unifies fuzzy reasoning with additive function decomposition. KANFIS employs an additive aggregation mechanism, under which both model parameters and rule complexity scale linearly with input dimensionality rather than exponentially. Furthermore, KANFIS is compatible with both Type-1 (T1) and Interval Type-2 (IT2) fuzzy logic systems, enabling explicit modeling of uncertainty and ambiguity in fuzzy representations. By using sparse masking mechanisms, KANFIS generates compact and structured rule sets, resulting in an intrinsically interpretable model with clear rule semantics and transparent inference processes. Empirical results demonstrate that KANFIS achieves competitive performance against representative neural and neuro-fuzzy baselines.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为KANFIS的新型紧凑型神经符号架构，它通过将模糊推理与加性函数分解相结合，解决了传统ANFIS在处理高维数据时规则爆炸的问题。
AI.motivation: 传统的ANFIS架构存在结构复杂性问题，基于乘积的推理机制在高维空间中会导致规则数量呈指数级增长。研究者希望开发一种更紧凑、可扩展性更好的神经模糊推理系统。
AI.method: KANFIS采用加性聚合机制，将模糊推理与加性函数分解相结合。该机制使得模型参数和规则复杂度随输入维度的增加呈线性增长而非指数增长。KANFIS同时兼容T1和IT2模糊逻辑系统，并利用稀疏掩码机制生成紧凑、结构化的规则集，增强模型的可解释性。
AI.result: KANFIS在经验评估中表现出与代表性的神经网络和神经模糊基线相当的性能，同时生成了规则集更紧凑、解释性更强的模型。
AI.conclusion: KANFIS是一种创新的神经符号架构，它通过引入加性聚合和支持IT2模糊逻辑，有效解决了传统ANFIS的规则爆炸问题，并提高了模型的可解释性，在保持竞争力的性能的同时，能够更有效地处理高维不确定性问题。

title: Short Chains, Deep Thoughts: Balancing Reasoning Efficiency and Intra-Segment Capability via Split-Merge Optimization
summary: While Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in solving complex tasks through the generation of long reasoning chains, this reliance on verbose generation results in significant latency and computational overhead. To address these challenges, we propose \textbf{CoSMo} (\textbf{Co}nsistency-Guided \textbf{S}plit-\textbf{M}erge \textbf{O}ptimization), a framework designed to eliminate structural redundancy rather than indiscriminately restricting token volume. Specifically, CoSMo utilizes a split-merge algorithm that dynamically refines reasoning chains by merging redundant segments and splitting logical gaps to ensure coherence. We then employ structure-aligned reinforcement learning with a novel segment-level budget to supervise the model in maintaining efficient reasoning structures throughout training. Extensive experiments across multiple benchmarks and backbones demonstrate that CoSMo achieves superior performance, improving accuracy by \textbf{3.3} points while reducing segment usage by \textbf{28.7\%} on average compared to reasoning efficiency baselines.

AI.tldr: 提出CoSMo框架，通过一致性指导的分割-合并优化来减少大型推理模型（LRM）的冗余推理链，从而提高效率和准确性。
AI.motivation: 大型推理模型（LRM）在解决复杂任务时依赖于冗长的推理链，这导致了显著的延迟和计算开销。
AI.method: 提出CoSMo框架，使用分割-合并算法动态优化推理链，通过合并冗余片段和分割逻辑缺口来确保连贯性。采用结构对齐的强化学习和新颖的片段级预算来监督模型。
AI.result: 在多个基准测试和骨干网络上，CoSMo的准确率平均提高了3.3个百分点，同时平均将片段使用量减少了28.7%。
AI.conclusion: CoSMo框架能够有效地消除结构冗余，提高LRM的推理效率和准确性，优于现有的推理效率基线方法。

title: Beyond Cropping and Rotation: Automated Evolution of Powerful Task-Specific Augmentations with Generative Models
summary: Data augmentation has long been a cornerstone for reducing overfitting in vision models, with methods like AutoAugment automating the design of task-specific augmentations. Recent advances in generative models, such as conditional diffusion and few-shot NeRFs, offer a new paradigm for data augmentation by synthesizing data with significantly greater diversity and realism. However, unlike traditional augmentations like cropping or rotation, these methods introduce substantial changes that enhance robustness but also risk degrading performance if the augmentations are poorly matched to the task. In this work, we present EvoAug, an automated augmentation learning pipeline, which leverages these generative models alongside an efficient evolutionary algorithm to learn optimal task-specific augmentations. Our pipeline introduces a novel approach to image augmentation that learns stochastic augmentation trees that hierarchically compose augmentations, enabling more structured and adaptive transformations. We demonstrate strong performance across fine-grained classification and few-shot learning tasks. Notably, our pipeline discovers augmentations that align with domain knowledge, even in low-data settings. These results highlight the potential of learned generative augmentations, unlocking new possibilities for robust model training.

AI.tldr: EvoAug是一个自动化的数据增强学习管道，它结合了生成模型和进化算法，以学习最优的任务特定增强方法。该方法通过学习随机增强树来生成结构化和自适应的转换，并在细粒度分类和少样本学习任务中取得了优异的性能。
AI.motivation: 传统的图像数据增强方法（如裁剪、旋转）在提高模型鲁棒性方面有限，而生成模型（如条件扩散、NeRFs）虽然能生成更多样化和逼真的数据，但其引入的显著变化可能损害模型性能。因此，需要一种自动化的方法来学习与特定任务相匹配的、利用生成模型优势的数据增强策略。
AI.method: EvoAug管道利用生成模型（如条件扩散、NeRFs）和高效的进化算法来学习任务特定的数据增强。其核心是一种新颖的图像增强方法，该方法学习随机增强树，该树能够分层地组合增强操作，从而实现更结构化和自适应的转换。
AI.result: EvoAug在细粒度分类和少样本学习任务中展现出强大的性能。该管道发现的增强方法与领域知识相符，即使在数据量少的情况下也能有效工作。这些结果表明，学习到的生成式增强方法在模型训练中具有巨大潜力。
AI.conclusion: EvoAug管道能够自动学习最优的任务特定数据增强，利用生成模型的优势来提高模型的鲁棒性，同时避免性能下降。学习到的增强策略具有结构化和自适应性，并且在低数据场景下也能发现与领域知识一致的增强方法，为模型训练提供了新的可能性。

title: Enhancing Navigation Efficiency of Quadruped Robots via Leveraging Personal Transportation Platforms
comment: Accepted to ICRA 2025. Project Page
summary: Quadruped robots face limitations in long-range navigation efficiency due to their reliance on legs. To ameliorate the limitations, we introduce a Reinforcement Learning-based Active Transporter Riding method (\textit{RL-ATR}), inspired by humans' utilization of personal transporters, including Segways. The \textit{RL-ATR} features a transporter riding policy and two state estimators. The policy devises adequate maneuvering strategies according to transporter-specific control dynamics, while the estimators resolve sensor ambiguities in non-inertial frames by inferring unobservable robot and transporter states. Comprehensive evaluations in simulation validate proficient command tracking abilities across various transporter-robot models and reduced energy consumption compared to legged locomotion. Moreover, we conduct ablation studies to quantify individual component contributions within the \textit{RL-ATR}. This riding ability could broaden the locomotion modalities of quadruped robots, potentially expanding the operational range and efficiency.

AI.tldr: 提出一种基于强化学习的主动交通工具骑行（RL-ATR）方法，使四足机器人能够像人类骑行Segway一样，通过乘坐交通工具进行高效长距离导航，并降低能耗。
AI.motivation: 四足机器人在长距离导航方面存在效率低下的问题，因为它们依赖腿部移动。为了克服这一限制，研究者受到人类利用个人交通工具（如Segway）的启发。
AI.method: 提出RL-ATR方法，包含一个交通工具骑行策略和两个状态估计器。骑行策略能够根据交通工具特有的控制动力学制定适当的机动策略。状态估计器通过推断不可观察的机器人和交通工具状态来解决非惯性参考系中的传感器模糊性。
AI.result: 在仿真环境中进行了全面评估，结果表明RL-ATR在不同交通工具-机器人模型下均能熟练地跟踪指令，并且与纯粹的腿部运动相比，能耗有所降低。消融研究也量化了RL-ATR中各个组件的贡献。
AI.conclusion: RL-ATR方法为四足机器人提供了新的移动模式，能够乘坐交通工具进行高效导航，有望扩大其操作范围和效率。

title: FASA: Frequency-aware Sparse Attention
summary: The deployment of Large Language Models (LLMs) faces a critical bottleneck when handling lengthy inputs: the prohibitive memory footprint of the Key Value (KV) cache. To address this bottleneck, the token pruning paradigm leverages attention sparsity to selectively retain a small, critical subset of tokens. However, existing approaches fall short, with static methods risking irreversible information loss and dynamic strategies employing heuristics that insufficiently capture the query-dependent nature of token importance. We propose FASA, a novel framework that achieves query-aware token eviction by dynamically predicting token importance. FASA stems from a novel insight into RoPE: the discovery of functional sparsity at the frequency-chunk (FC) level. Our key finding is that a small, identifiable subset of "dominant" FCs consistently exhibits high contextual agreement with the full attention head. This provides a robust and computationally free proxy for identifying salient tokens. %making them a powerful and efficient proxy for token importance. Building on this insight, FASA first identifies a critical set of tokens using dominant FCs, and then performs focused attention computation solely on this pruned subset. % Since accessing only a small fraction of the KV cache, FASA drastically lowers memory bandwidth requirements and computational cost. Across a spectrum of long-context tasks, from sequence modeling to complex CoT reasoning, FASA consistently outperforms all token-eviction baselines and achieves near-oracle accuracy, demonstrating remarkable robustness even under constraint budgets. Notably, on LongBench-V1, FASA reaches nearly 100\% of full-KV performance when only keeping 256 tokens, and achieves 2.56$\times$ speedup using just 18.9\% of the cache on AIME24.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为FASA的新框架，通过识别RoPE（旋转位置嵌入）中的“主导”频率块（FC）来动态预测Token的重要性，从而实现查询感知的Token剔除，显著降低LLM处理长文本时的内存和计算开销，同时保持近乎完美的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM在处理长输入时存在内存瓶颈，主要是由于KV缓存的巨大内存占用。现有的Token剪枝方法要么采用静态方法导致信息丢失，要么采用启发式动态方法，未能充分捕捉Token对查询的重要性。
AI.method: FASA框架的核心在于 RoPE 的“功能稀疏性”新发现，即在频率块（FC）层面存在一种可识别的“主导”FC子集，它们能高度反映整个注意力头的内容。FASA利用这一发现，通过识别主导FC来动态预测Token的重要性，并仅在选定的Token子集上进行注意力计算。
AI.result: FASA在多种长文本任务（包括序列建模和复杂推理）上，均优于现有的Token剔除基线方法，并达到了接近最优的准确率。在LongBench-V1上，仅保留256个Token时，FASA性能接近全KV缓存；在AIME24上，使用18.9%的缓存实现了2.56倍的加速。
AI.conclusion: FASA是一种高效且查询感知的Token剔除框架，通过利用RoPE中的频率块特性，能够有效降低LLM处理长文本的内存和计算成本，同时保持卓越的性能和鲁棒性。

title: Learning-based Initialization of Trajectory Optimization for Path-following Problems of Redundant Manipulators
comment: Accepted to ICRA 2023. Project Page
summary: Trajectory optimization (TO) is an efficient tool to generate a redundant manipulator's joint trajectory following a 6-dimensional Cartesian path. The optimization performance largely depends on the quality of initial trajectories. However, the selection of a high-quality initial trajectory is non-trivial and requires a considerable time budget due to the extremely large space of the solution trajectories and the lack of prior knowledge about task constraints in configuration space. To alleviate the issue, we present a learning-based initial trajectory generation method that generates high-quality initial trajectories in a short time budget by adopting example-guided reinforcement learning. In addition, we suggest a null-space projected imitation reward to consider null-space constraints by efficiently learning kinematically feasible motion captured in expert demonstrations. Our statistical evaluation in simulation shows the improved optimality, efficiency, and applicability of TO when we plug in our method's output, compared with three other baselines. We also show the performance improvement and feasibility via real-world experiments with a seven-degree-of-freedom manipulator.

AI.tldr: 提出一种基于学习的冗余机械臂初始轨迹生成方法，通过示例引导强化学习和空域投影模仿奖励，能够快速生成高质量的初始轨迹，并提高轨迹优化的性能。
AI.motivation: 传统轨迹优化方法在生成冗余机械臂的初始轨迹时存在困难，选择高质量的初始轨迹耗时且需要先验知识，限制了优化性能。
AI.method: 采用示例引导强化学习（example-guided reinforcement learning）生成高质量的初始轨迹，并结合空域投影模仿奖励（null-space projected imitation reward）来考虑空域约束。
AI.result: 与三种基线方法相比，所提出的方法生成的初始轨迹能够显著提高轨迹优化的最优性、效率和适用性，并在真实世界的实验中得到验证。
AI.conclusion: 基于学习的初始轨迹生成方法能够有效地解决冗余机械臂轨迹优化中的初始轨迹选择难题，显著提升了轨迹优化的整体性能。

title: De-conflating Preference and Qualification: Constrained Dual-Perspective Reasoning for Job Recommendation with Large Language Models
summary: Professional job recommendation involves a complex bipartite matching process that must reconcile a candidate's subjective preference with an employer's objective qualification. While Large Language Models (LLMs) are well-suited for modeling the rich semantics of resumes and job descriptions, existing paradigms often collapse these two decision dimensions into a single interaction signal, yielding confounded supervision under recruitment-funnel censoring and limiting policy controllability. To address these challenges, We propose JobRec, a generative job recommendation framework for de-conflating preference and qualification via constrained dual-perspective reasoning. JobRec introduces a Unified Semantic Alignment Schema that aligns candidate and job attributes into structured semantic layers, and a Two-Stage Cooperative Training Strategy that learns decoupled experts to separately infer preference and qualification. Building on these experts, a Lagrangian-based Policy Alignment module optimizes recommendations under explicit eligibility requirements, enabling controllable trade-offs. To mitigate data scarcity, we construct a synthetic dataset refined by experts. Experiments show that JobRec consistently outperforms strong baselines and provides improved controllability for strategy-aware professional matching.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一个名为JobRec的生成式职位推荐框架，通过解耦偏好和资质来解决现有LLM推荐方法中的问题，并引入了统一语义对齐模式和两阶段协同训练策略，通过基于Lagrangian的策略对齐模块实现了可控的推荐。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLMs）在职位推荐中存在将候选人主观偏好和雇主客观资质混淆的问题，导致监督信号混杂且策略可控性受限，特别是在招聘漏斗审查下。研究旨在解决这一挑战，实现偏好和资质的解耦。
AI.method: 提出JobRec框架，包含：1. 统一语义对齐模式（Unified Semantic Alignment Schema），将候选人和职位属性对齐到结构化语义层；2. 两阶段协同训练策略（Two-Stage Cooperative Training Strategy），学习独立的偏好和资质推断专家；3. 基于Lagrangian的策略对齐模块（Lagrangian-based Policy Alignment module），根据明确的资格要求优化推荐并实现可控的权衡。
AI.result: JobRec在合成数据集上的实验结果显示，其性能持续优于强基线模型，并提供了更强的策略感知匹配可控性。同时，研究构建了一个经过专家精炼的合成数据集来缓解数据稀缺问题。
AI.conclusion: JobRec通过解耦偏好和资质，并引入策略对齐模块，成功地实现了更优、更可控的专业职位推荐。该框架能够处理更复杂的匹配需求，并在实际应用中展现出优势。

title: Feature, Alignment, and Supervision in Category Learning: A Comparative Approach with Children and Neural Networks
summary: Understanding how humans and machines learn from sparse data is central to cognitive science and machine learning. Using a species-fair design, we compare children and convolutional neural networks (CNNs) in a few-shot semi-supervised category learning task. Both learners are exposed to novel object categories under identical conditions. Learners receive mixtures of labeled and unlabeled exemplars while we vary supervision (1/3/6 labels), target feature (size, shape, pattern), and perceptual alignment (high/low). We find that children generalize rapidly from minimal labels but show strong feature-specific biases and sensitivity to alignment. CNNs show a different interaction profile: added supervision improves performance, but both alignment and feature structure moderate the impact additional supervision has on learning. These results show that human-model comparisons must be drawn under the right conditions, emphasizing interactions among supervision, feature structure, and alignment rather than overall accuracy.

AI.tldr: 本研究比较了儿童和卷积神经网络（CNNs）在少量监督下的半监督类别学习能力。研究发现，儿童能从少量标签中快速泛化，但表现出强烈的特定特征偏见和对对齐的敏感性。CNNs则表现出不同的交互模式，监督的增加可以提高性能，但对齐和特征结构会调节额外监督对学习的影响。
AI.motivation: 理解人类和机器如何从稀疏数据中学习是认知科学和机器学习的核心问题。本研究旨在通过物种公平的设计，比较儿童和CNNs在少样本半监督类别学习任务中的表现，以期为理解和改进学习机制提供启示。
AI.method: 本研究采用物种公平的设计，让儿童和CNNs在相同的条件下接触新物体类别。研究操纵了监督水平（1/3/6个标签）、目标特征（大小、形状、图案）和感知对齐（高/低），并让学习者接触混合标签和无标签的样本。研究通过比较两者的性能来分析其学习模式。
AI.result: 研究发现，儿童能从极少的标签中快速泛化，但对特征有强烈的偏好，并且对感知对齐非常敏感。CNNs的学习模式与儿童不同：增加监督水平能提升性能，但感知对齐和特征结构会影响额外监督的学习效果。两者的性能差异表明，在进行人机比较时，需要关注监督、特征结构和对齐之间的相互作用，而非仅仅关注总体准确率。
AI.conclusion: 本研究强调，在进行人类与模型（如CNNs）的学习能力比较时，必须在恰当的条件下进行。研究结果表明，监督水平、特征结构和感知对齐之间的交互作用，比单纯的准确率更能揭示学习机制的异同。这对于设计更有效的学习算法和理解人类认知过程具有重要意义。

title: Deep-Learning-Based Control of a Decoupled Two-Segment Continuum Robot for Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection
summary: Manual endoscopic submucosal dissection (ESD) is technically demanding, and existing single-segment robotic tools offer limited dexterity. These limitations motivate the development of more advanced solutions. To address this, DESectBot, a novel dual segment continuum robot with a decoupled structure and integrated surgical forceps, enabling 6 degrees of freedom (DoFs) tip dexterity for improved lesion targeting in ESD, was developed in this work. Deep learning controllers based on gated recurrent units (GRUs) for simultaneous tip position and orientation control, effectively handling the nonlinear coupling between continuum segments, were proposed. The GRU controller was benchmarked against Jacobian based inverse kinematics, model predictive control (MPC), a feedforward neural network (FNN), and a long short-term memory (LSTM) network. In nested-rectangle and Lissajous trajectory tracking tasks, the GRU achieved the lowest position/orientation RMSEs: 1.11 mm/ 4.62° and 0.81 mm/ 2.59°, respectively. For orientation control at a fixed position (four target poses), the GRU attained a mean RMSE of 0.14 mm and 0.72°, outperforming all alternatives. In a peg transfer task, the GRU achieved a 100% success rate (120 success/120 attempts) with an average transfer time of 11.8s, the STD significantly outperforms novice-controlled systems. Additionally, an ex vivo ESD demonstration grasping, elevating, and resecting tissue as the scalpel completed the cut confirmed that DESectBot provides sufficient stiffness to divide thick gastric mucosa and an operative workspace adequate for large lesions.These results confirm that GRU-based control significantly enhances precision, reliability, and usability in ESD surgical training scenarios.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为DESectBot的新型双节段连续体机器人，该机器人具有解耦结构和集成手术镊子，可实现6自由度末端操作，以提高内镜黏膜下剥离术（ESD）中的病灶靶向精度。并开发了一种基于门控循环单元（GRU）的深度学习控制器，用于同时控制末端位置和姿态，有效解决了连续体片段之间的非线性耦合问题。
AI.motivation: 手动内镜黏膜下剥离术（ESD）技术要求高，且现有的单节段机器人工具灵活性有限，这促使了更先进解决方案的开发。
AI.method: 开发了名为DESectBot的双节段连续体机器人，具有解耦结构和集成手术镊子，可实现6自由度末端操作。使用基于门控循环单元（GRU）的深度学习控制器进行同时的末端位置和姿态控制，并与基于雅可比逆运动学、模型预测控制（MPC）、前馈神经网络（FNN）和长短期记忆（LSTM）网络等方法进行了基准测试。
AI.result: GRU控制器在嵌套矩形和利萨茹轨迹跟踪任务中取得了最低的位置/姿态均方根误差（RMSE），分别为1.11 mm/4.62°和0.81 mm/2.59°。在固定位置（四种目标姿态）的姿态控制中，GRU的平均RMSE为0.14 mm和0.72°，优于所有其他方法。在钉孔转移任务中，GRU的成功率为100%（120次成功/120次尝试），平均转移时间为11.8秒，显著优于新手控制的系统。离体ESD演示表明DESectBot具有足够的刚度来切割厚胃黏膜，并且操作空间足以应对大病灶。
AI.conclusion: GRU控制显著提高了ESD手术训练场景中的精度、可靠性和可用性，DESectBot为ESD手术提供了一种有前景的机器人辅助解决方案。

title: Flexible Geometric Guidance for Probabilistic Human Pose Estimation with Diffusion Models
summary: 3D human pose estimation from 2D images is a challenging problem due to depth ambiguity and occlusion. Because of these challenges the task is underdetermined, where there exists multiple -- possibly infinite -- poses that are plausible given the image. Despite this, many prior works assume the existence of a deterministic mapping and estimate a single pose given an image. Furthermore, methods based on machine learning require a large amount of paired 2D-3D data to train and suffer from generalization issues to unseen scenarios. To address both of these issues, we propose a framework for pose estimation using diffusion models, which enables sampling from a probability distribution over plausible poses which are consistent with a 2D image. Our approach falls under the guidance framework for conditional generation, and guides samples from an unconditional diffusion model, trained only on 3D data, using the gradients of the heatmaps from a 2D keypoint detector. We evaluate our method on the Human 3.6M dataset under best-of-$m$ multiple hypothesis evaluation, showing state-of-the-art performance among methods which do not require paired 2D-3D data for training. We additionally evaluate the generalization ability using the MPI-INF-3DHP and 3DPW datasets and demonstrate competitive performance. Finally, we demonstrate the flexibility of our framework by using it for novel tasks including pose generation and pose completion, without the need to train bespoke conditional models. We make code available at https://github.com/fsnelgar/diffusion_pose .

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于扩散模型的3D人体姿态估计框架，该框架能够从2D图像中生成概率分布上的多重姿态，克服了传统方法单一定义和对配对2D-3D训练数据依赖的问题，并在多个数据集上取得了最先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有3D人体姿态估计方法面临深度模糊、遮挡导致的“多解性”问题，且许多方法假设存在确定性映射，忽略了问题的多解性。此外，基于机器学习的方法需要大量配对的2D-3D数据进行训练，并且泛化能力不足。
AI.method: 该方法利用扩散模型进行3D人体姿态估计。具体而言，它采用条件生成框架，通过2D关键点检测器提取的热图的梯度来指导仅在3D数据上训练的无条件扩散模型生成样本，从而实现从2D图像生成一个概率分布上的多重姿态。
AI.result: 在Human 3.6M数据集的best-of-$m$评估中，该方法取得了优于其他不依赖配对2D-3D训练数据的最先进性能。在MPI-INF-3DHP和3DPW数据集上的泛化能力测试中也表现出具有竞争力的性能。此外，该框架还被成功应用于姿态生成和姿态补全等新任务，无需训练专门的条件模型。
AI.conclusion: 提出的基于扩散模型的框架成功解决了3D人体姿态估计中的多解性和对配对训练数据依赖的挑战，并在多个数据集上取得了优异的性能。该框架还展现了其灵活性，可应用于多种新颖的姿态相关任务。

title: MAS-ProVe: Understanding the Process Verification of Multi-Agent Systems
summary: Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) built on Large Language Models (LLMs) often exhibit high variance in their reasoning trajectories. Process verification, which evaluates intermediate steps in trajectories, has shown promise in general reasoning settings, and has been suggested as a potential tool for guiding coordination of MAS; however, its actual effectiveness in MAS remains unclear. To fill this gap, we present MAS-ProVe, a systematic empirical study of process verification for multi-agent systems (MAS). Our study spans three verification paradigms (LLM-as-a-Judge, reward models, and process reward models), evaluated across two levels of verification granularity (agent-level and iteration-level). We further examine five representative verifiers and four context management strategies, and conduct experiments over six diverse MAS frameworks on multiple reasoning benchmarks. We find that process-level verification does not consistently improve performance and frequently exhibits high variance, highlighting the difficulty of reliably evaluating partial multi-agent trajectories. Among the methods studied, LLM-as-a-Judge generally outperforms reward-based approaches, with trained judges surpassing general-purpose LLMs. We further observe a small performance gap between LLMs acting as judges and as single agents, and identify a context-length-performance trade-off in verification. Overall, our results suggest that effective and robust process verification for MAS remains an open challenge, requiring further advances beyond current paradigms. Code is available at https://github.com/Wang-ML-Lab/MAS-ProVe.

AI.tldr: 本文对基于大型语言模型（LLM）的多智能体系统（MAS）的进程验证进行了系统性的实证研究，发现在现有框架下，进程级验证并不能稳定地提升性能，且方差较高，表明可靠评估MAS的中间轨迹存在挑战。LLM-as-a-Judge方法优于基于奖励的方法，并且上下文长度与性能之间存在权衡。
AI.motivation: 多智能体系统（MAS）基于大型语言模型（LLM）时，其推理轨迹的方差很高。进程验证被认为是解决这一问题并指导MAS协调的潜在工具，但其在MAS中的实际有效性尚不明确，因此需要进行系统性的实证研究。
AI.method: 本文提出了MAS-ProVe，一个对MAS进行进程验证的系统性实证研究。该研究涵盖了三种验证范式（LLM-as-a-Judge、奖励模型和进程奖励模型），两种验证粒度（Agent-level和Iteration-level）。此外，研究还考察了五种代表性的验证器和四种上下文管理策略，并在六种不同的MAS框架和多个推理基准上进行了实验。
AI.result: 进程级验证并不能稳定地提升MAS的性能，并且经常表现出高方差。LLM-as-a-Judge方法通常优于基于奖励的方法，其中经过训练的Judge的性能优于通用LLM。LLM作为Judge和作为单个Agent的性能差距很小，并且在验证过程中存在上下文长度-性能权衡。
AI.conclusion: 目前的研究表明，对MAS进行有效且鲁棒的进程验证仍然是一个开放的挑战，需要超越现有范式的新进展。

title: Risky-Bench: Probing Agentic Safety Risks under Real-World Deployment
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed as agents that operate in real-world environments, introducing safety risks beyond linguistic harm. Existing agent safety evaluations rely on risk-oriented tasks tailored to specific agent settings, resulting in limited coverage of safety risk space and failing to assess agent safety behavior during long-horizon, interactive task execution in complex real-world deployments. Moreover, their specialization to particular agent settings limits adaptability across diverse agent configurations. To address these limitations, we propose Risky-Bench, a framework that enables systematic agent safety evaluation grounded in real-world deployment. Risky-Bench organizes evaluation around domain-agnostic safety principles to derive context-aware safety rubrics that delineate safety space, and systematically evaluates safety risks across this space through realistic task execution under varying threat assumptions. When applied to life-assist agent settings, Risky-Bench uncovers substantial safety risks in state-of-the-art agents under realistic execution conditions. Moreover, as a well-structured evaluation pipeline, Risky-Bench is not confined to life-assist scenarios and can be adapted to other deployment settings to construct environment-specific safety evaluations, providing an extensible methodology for agent safety assessment.

AI.tldr: 提出 Risky-Bench 框架，用于系统化评估大型语言模型（LLMs）作为在现实世界环境中运行的代理时的安全风险，该框架基于领域无关的安全原则，并允许在不同部署场景下进行适应性评估。
AI.motivation: 现有 LLM 代理安全评估方法存在局限性：1. 评估任务针对特定场景，覆盖的安全风险空间有限；2. 无法评估代理在长周期、交互式任务执行中的安全行为；3. 评估方法难以适应不同的代理配置。
AI.method: 提出 Risky-Bench 框架，其核心是通过领域无关的安全原则来构建上下文感知的安全评估标准，从而划定安全风险空间。然后，在不同威胁假设下，通过执行真实的、长周期的交互式任务来系统地评估该空间内的安全风险。
AI.result: 将 Risky-Bench 应用于生命辅助代理场景，发现了当前最先进的代理在现实执行条件下存在显著的安全风险。此外，Risky-Bench 框架具有良好的结构和可扩展性，可以适应其他部署场景，构建特定环境的安全评估。
AI.conclusion: Risky-Bench 提供了一种系统化、适应性强的 LLM 代理安全评估方法，能够更全面地揭示代理在真实世界部署中的安全风险，并且能够推广到不同的代理配置和应用场景。

title: Privasis: Synthesizing the Largest "Public" Private Dataset from Scratch
comment: For code and data, see https://privasis.github.io
summary: Research involving privacy-sensitive data has always been constrained by data scarcity, standing in sharp contrast to other areas that have benefited from data scaling. This challenge is becoming increasingly urgent as modern AI agents--such as OpenClaw and Gemini Agent--are granted persistent access to highly sensitive personal information. To tackle this longstanding bottleneck and the rising risks, we present Privasis (i.e., privacy oasis), the first million-scale fully synthetic dataset entirely built from scratch--an expansive reservoir of texts with rich and diverse private information--designed to broaden and accelerate research in areas where processing sensitive social data is inevitable. Compared to existing datasets, Privasis, comprising 1.4 million records, offers orders-of-magnitude larger scale with quality, and far greater diversity across various document types, including medical history, legal documents, financial records, calendars, and text messages with a total of 55.1 million annotated attributes such as ethnicity, date of birth, workplace, etc. We leverage Privasis to construct a parallel corpus for text sanitization with our pipeline that decomposes texts and applies targeted sanitization. Our compact sanitization models (<=4B) trained on this dataset outperform state-of-the-art large language models, such as GPT-5 and Qwen-3 235B. We plan to release data, models, and code to accelerate future research on privacy-sensitive domains and agents.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了Privasis，一个百万级规模的全合成隐私敏感数据集，用于加速和扩展在处理敏感社交数据方面的研究，并构建了一个高效的文本去标识化模型。
AI.motivation: 研究隐私敏感数据面临数据稀疏的挑战，而现代AI代理（如OpenClaw和Gemini Agent）却被赋予了持久访问高度敏感个人信息的权限，这增加了紧迫性。为了解决这一长期存在的瓶颈和日益增长的风险，研究者需要一个大规模、多样化的数据集来支持相关研究。
AI.method: 研究者构建了一个名为Privasis的百万级全合成数据集，包含140万条记录，覆盖医疗、法律、金融、日历和短信等多种文档类型，并标注了5510万个属性。利用Privasis，研究者构建了一个并行语料库，并开发了一个文本去标识化流水线，该流水线能分解文本并进行定向去标识化。他们训练了紧凑型（<=4B）去标识化模型。
AI.result: Privasis数据集规模是现有数据集的几个数量级，质量和多样性也远超以往。在Privasis上训练的紧凑型去标识化模型在文本去标识化任务上表现优于GPT-5和Qwen-3 235B等先进的大型语言模型。
AI.conclusion: Privasis是一个开创性的、大规模的全合成隐私敏感数据集，能够显著促进和加速涉及隐私敏感数据的研究。基于该数据集训练的去标识化模型在性能上超越了现有的大型模型，研究者计划公开数据、模型和代码以鼓励未来的研究。

title: FinMTM: A Multi-Turn Multimodal Benchmark for Financial Reasoning and Agent Evaluation
summary: The financial domain poses substantial challenges for vision-language models (VLMs) due to specialized chart formats and knowledge-intensive reasoning requirements. However, existing financial benchmarks are largely single-turn and rely on a narrow set of question formats, limiting comprehensive evaluation in realistic application scenarios. To address this gap, we propose FinMTM, a multi-turn multimodal benchmark that expands diversity along both data and task dimensions. On the data side, we curate and annotate 11{,}133 bilingual (Chinese and English) financial QA pairs grounded in financial visuals, including candlestick charts, statistical plots, and report figures. On the task side, FinMTM covers single- and multiple-choice questions, multi-turn open-ended dialogues, and agent-based tasks. We further design task-specific evaluation protocols, including a set-overlap scoring rule for multiple-choice questions, a weighted combination of turn-level and session-level scores for multi-turn dialogues, and a composite metric that integrates planning quality with final outcomes for agent tasks. Extensive experimental evaluation of 22 VLMs reveal their limitations in fine-grained visual perception, long-context reasoning, and complex agent workflows.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了FinMTM，一个多模态、多轮次的金融领域问答基准，包含11,133个中英双语问答对和多种任务类型（单选、多选、开放式对话、基于代理的任务），旨在更全面地评估视觉语言模型在金融领域的表现。
AI.motivation: 现有金融领域的视觉语言模型评估基准存在局限性，主要体现在：1. 金融领域特有的图表格式和知识密集型推理需求；2. 现有基准多为单轮次且问题格式单一，无法模拟真实应用场景。因此，需要一个更具多样性、更贴近实际的评估基准。
AI.method: 构建FinMTM基准，包含：1. 数据收集与标注：11,133个中英双语金融问答对，涵盖蜡烛图、统计图表、报告图等；2. 任务设计：包含单选、多选、多轮开放式对话、基于代理的任务；3. 评估协议：针对不同任务设计了集重叠评分规则、多轮对话的轮次与会话结合评分、代理任务的规划与结果综合评分。
AI.result: 在FinMTM基准上对22个视觉语言模型进行的广泛实验表明，这些模型在精细视觉感知、长上下文推理以及复杂的代理工作流程方面存在不足。
AI.conclusion: FinMTM基准的提出填补了金融领域多模态、多轮次评估的空白，并通过实验揭示了现有视觉语言模型在处理复杂金融视觉问答任务时的局限性，为未来模型改进指明了方向。

title: ProAct: A Benchmark and Multimodal Framework for Structure-Aware Proactive Response
summary: While passive agents merely follow instructions, proactive agents align with higher-level objectives, such as assistance and safety by continuously monitoring the environment to determine when and how to act. However, developing proactive agents is hindered by the lack of specialized resources. To address this, we introduce ProAct-75, a benchmark designed to train and evaluate proactive agents across diverse domains, including assistance, maintenance, and safety monitoring. Spanning 75 tasks, our dataset features 91,581 step-level annotations enriched with explicit task graphs. These graphs encode step dependencies and parallel execution possibilities, providing the structural grounding necessary for complex decision-making. Building on this benchmark, we propose ProAct-Helper, a reference baseline powered by a Multimodal Large Language Model (MLLM) that grounds decision-making in state detection, and leveraging task graphs to enable entropy-driven heuristic search for action selection, allowing agents to execute parallel threads independently rather than mirroring the human's next step. Extensive experiments demonstrate that ProAct-Helper outperforms strong closed-source models, improving trigger detection mF1 by 6.21%, saving 0.25 more steps in online one-step decision, and increasing the rate of parallel actions by 15.58%.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了ProAct-75基准和ProAct-Helper模型，用于训练和评估跨领域的主动代理。ProAct-75包含75个任务、91,581个带任务图的标注，任务图编码了步骤依赖和并行执行的可能性。ProAct-Helper基于多模态大语言模型，通过状态检测和基于任务图的启发式搜索，实现了更优的触发检测、步骤节省和并行动作执行。
AI.motivation: 开发能够理解高层目标、持续监控环境并自主决定何时采取行动的主动代理面临专门资源缺乏的挑战。
AI.method: 提出了ProAct-75基准，包含75个任务、91,581个带显式任务图的步骤级别标注。任务图编码了步骤依赖和并行执行的可能性。在此基础上，提出了ProAct-Helper模型，该模型利用多模态大语言模型进行状态检测，并利用任务图进行基于熵的启发式搜索来选择动作，从而实现独立并行执行。
AI.result: ProAct-Helper在触发检测方面比闭源模型提高了6.21%的mF1分数，在在线一步决策中节省了0.25个步骤，并提高了15.58%的并行动作执行率。
AI.conclusion: ProAct-75基准和ProAct-Helper模型为开发和评估主动代理提供了有效的解决方案，并在多个关键指标上取得了显著的性能提升。

title: ForesightKV: Optimizing KV Cache Eviction for Reasoning Models by Learning Long-Term Contribution
summary: Recently, large language models (LLMs) have shown remarkable reasoning abilities by producing long reasoning traces. However, as the sequence length grows, the key-value (KV) cache expands linearly, incurring significant memory and computation costs. Existing KV cache eviction methods mitigate this issue by discarding less important KV pairs, but often fail to capture complex KV dependencies, resulting in performance degradation. To better balance efficiency and performance, we introduce ForesightKV, a training-based KV cache eviction framework that learns to predict which KV pairs to evict during long-text generations. We first design the Golden Eviction algorithm, which identifies the optimal eviction KV pairs at each step using future attention scores. These traces and the scores at each step are then distilled via supervised training with a Pairwise Ranking Loss. Furthermore, we formulate cache eviction as a Markov Decision Process and apply the GRPO algorithm to mitigate the significant language modeling loss increase on low-entropy tokens. Experiments on AIME2024 and AIME2025 benchmarks of three reasoning models demonstrate that ForesightKV consistently outperforms prior methods under only half the cache budget, while benefiting synergistically from both supervised and reinforcement learning approaches.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 ForesightKV 的训练式 KV 缓存淘汰框架，通过学习预测哪些 KV 对需要被淘汰，从而在长文本生成中平衡效率和性能。它通过 Golden Eviction 算法找到最优淘汰策略，并利用监督学习和强化学习进行优化，在仅使用一半缓存预算的情况下，性能优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 现有 KV 缓存淘汰方法在处理长序列时，由于 KV 缓存线性增长带来的内存和计算成本，以及对复杂 KV 依赖捕获不足导致性能下降，需要一种更有效的方法。
AI.method: ForesightKV 框架结合了监督学习和强化学习。首先，Golden Eviction 算法利用未来注意力分数识别最优淘汰 KV 对。然后，通过 Pairwise Ranking Loss 对这些轨迹和分数进行监督训练。最后，将缓存淘汰建模为马尔可夫决策过程，并应用 GRPO 算法来解决低熵标记上的语言模型损失增加问题。
AI.result: 在 AIME2024 和 AIME2025 基准测试中，ForesightKV 在三种推理模型上，使用仅一半的缓存预算，表现持续优于现有方法。
AI.conclusion: ForesightKV 是一种有效的训练式 KV 缓存淘汰框架，通过结合监督学习和强化学习，能够在显著降低内存和计算成本的同时，保持或提升模型性能，尤其是在长文本生成任务中。

title: SwiftVLM: Efficient Vision-Language Model Inference via Cross-Layer Token Bypass
summary: Visual token pruning is a promising approach for reducing the computational cost of vision-language models (VLMs), and existing methods often rely on early pruning decisions to improve efficiency. While effective on coarse-grained reasoning tasks, they suffer from significant performance degradation on tasks requiring fine-grained visual details. Through layer-wise analysis, we reveal substantial discrepancies in visual token importance across layers, showing that tokens deemed unimportant at shallow layers can later become highly relevant for text-conditioned reasoning. To avoid irreversible critical information loss caused by premature pruning, we introduce a new pruning paradigm, termed bypass, which preserves unselected visual tokens and forwards them to subsequent pruning stages for re-evaluation. Building on this paradigm, we propose SwiftVLM, a simple and training-free method that performs pruning at model-specific layers with strong visual token selection capability, while enabling independent pruning decisions across layers. Experiments across multiple VLMs and benchmarks demonstrate that SwiftVLM consistently outperforms existing pruning strategies, achieving superior accuracy-efficiency trade-offs and more faithful visual token selection behavior.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种新的视觉token剪枝方法SwiftVLM，通过在后续层级重新评估被剪枝的token，有效解决了早期剪枝导致信息丢失的问题，并在多项任务上取得了比现有方法更好的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有视觉token剪枝方法在处理需要精细视觉细节的任务时性能下降明显，原因是早期剪枝可能导致关键信息永久丢失，而忽略了不同层级token重要性的差异。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为"bypass"的剪枝范式，允许未被选择的视觉token在后续层级被重新评估。在此基础上，设计了SwiftVLM方法，在模型特定的层级进行剪枝，并允许各层级独立做出剪枝决策。
AI.result: SwiftVLM在多个视觉语言模型和基准测试中，持续优于现有的剪枝策略，实现了更优的准确率-效率权衡，并且选择了更忠实的视觉token。
AI.conclusion: SwiftVLM通过其"bypass"范式和层级独立的剪枝策略，成功克服了早期剪枝的信息丢失问题，为提高视觉语言模型的效率和性能提供了一种有效的方法。

title: Understanding Multi-Agent LLM Frameworks: A Unified Benchmark and Experimental Analysis
comment: 25 pages, 9 figures and 13 tables; introduces MAFBench unified multi-agent evaluation suite
summary: Multi-agent LLM frameworks are widely used to accelerate the development of agent systems powered by large language models (LLMs). These frameworks impose distinct architectural structures that govern how agents interact, store information, and coordinate tasks. However, their impact on system performance remains poorly understood. This gap is critical, as architectural choices alone can induce order-of-magnitude differences in latency and throughput, as well as substantial variation in accuracy and scalability. Addressing this challenge requires (i) jointly evaluating multiple capabilities, such as orchestration overhead, memory behavior, planning, specialization, and coordination, and (ii) conducting these evaluations under controlled, framework-level conditions to isolate architectural effects. Existing benchmarks focus on individual capabilities and lack standardized framework-level evaluation. We address these limitations by (i) introducing an architectural taxonomy for systematically comparing multi-agent LLM frameworks along fundamental dimensions, and (ii) developing MAFBench, a unified evaluation suite that integrates existing benchmarks under a standardized execution pipeline. Using MAFBench, we conduct a controlled empirical study across several widely used frameworks. Our results show that framework-level design choices alone can increase latency by over 100x, reduce planning accuracy by up to 30%, and lower coordination success from above 90% to below 30%. Finally, we translate our findings into concrete architectural design principles and framework selection guidance, and outline promising future research directions.

AI.tldr: 本文通过引入一个多代理LLM框架的架构分类法，并开发了一个统一的评估套件MAFBench，对不同框架在延迟、准确性和可扩展性等方面的影响进行了实证研究，发现了框架设计对系统性能有显著影响，并提出了设计原则和选择指南。
AI.motivation: 现有的多代理LLM框架在系统性能（如延迟、吞吐量、准确性和可扩展性）方面的影响尚不明确，而架构选择是导致这些差异的关键因素。现有的基准测试未能充分评估框架层面的架构效应。
AI.method: 1. 提出了一个架构分类法，用于系统地比较多代理LLM框架的基本维度。2. 开发了MAFBench，一个集成现有基准测试的统一评估套件，用于在标准化执行流程下进行评估。3. 使用MAFBench对几个广泛使用的框架进行了受控的实证研究。
AI.result: 框架层面的设计选择会显著影响系统性能：可能导致延迟增加100倍以上，规划准确性降低高达30%，协调成功率从90%以上降至30%以下。
AI.conclusion: 多代理LLM框架的架构设计对系统性能有重要影响。本研究提出了改进框架设计的原则，并为框架选择提供了指导，同时指明了未来的研究方向。

title: Model-based Optimal Control for Rigid-Soft Underactuated Systems
summary: Continuum soft robots are inherently underactuated and subject to intrinsic input constraints, making dynamic control particularly challenging, especially in hybrid rigid-soft robots. While most existing methods focus on quasi-static behaviors, dynamic tasks such as swing-up require accurate exploitation of continuum dynamics. This has led to studies on simple low-order template systems that often fail to capture the complexity of real continuum deformations. Model-based optimal control offers a systematic solution; however, its application to rigid-soft robots is often limited by the computational cost and inaccuracy of numerical differentiation for high-dimensional models. Building on recent advances in the Geometric Variable Strain model that enable analytical derivatives, this work investigates three optimal control strategies for underactuated soft systems-Direct Collocation, Differential Dynamic Programming, and Nonlinear Model Predictive Control-to perform dynamic swing-up tasks. To address stiff continuum dynamics and constrained actuation, implicit integration schemes and warm-start strategies are employed to improve numerical robustness and computational efficiency. The methods are evaluated in simulation on three Rigid-Soft and high-order soft benchmark systems-the Soft Cart-Pole, the Soft Pendubot, and the Soft Furuta Pendulum- highlighting their performance and computational trade-offs.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了用于混合刚软连续体软机器人的三种最优控制策略（直接配置、微分动态规划和非线性模型预测控制），以执行动态摆动任务。通过利用几何可变应变模型和隐式积分方案，该方法在模拟中验证了其在复杂软机器人系统上的性能和计算效率。
AI.motivation: 现有的连续体软机器人控制方法多集中于拟静止行为，难以应对如摆动这样的动态任务，特别是对于混合刚软机器人。现有的低阶模型无法捕捉真实连续体变形的复杂性，而基于模型的最优控制受限于计算成本和数值微分的精度。
AI.method: 本文研究了三种最优控制策略：直接配置、微分动态规划和非线性模型预测控制。利用几何可变应变模型提供解析导数，并采用隐式积分方案和热启动策略来提高数值鲁棒性和计算效率。
AI.result: 在模拟中，三种控制策略均成功地在软机械臂-杆、软机械臂-摆和软福塔摆等高阶软系统上执行了动态摆动任务。研究突出了它们在性能和计算成本上的权衡。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的基于几何可变应变模型的优化控制方法能够有效地解决连续体软机器人（包括混合刚软系统）的动态控制挑战，并在计算效率和性能之间取得平衡。

title: Token Sparse Attention: Efficient Long-Context Inference with Interleaved Token Selection
summary: The quadratic complexity of attention remains the central bottleneck in long-context inference for large language models. Prior acceleration methods either sparsify the attention map with structured patterns or permanently evict tokens at specific layers, which can retain irrelevant tokens or rely on irreversible early decisions despite the layer-/head-wise dynamics of token importance. In this paper, we propose Token Sparse Attention, a lightweight and dynamic token-level sparsification mechanism that compresses per-head $Q$, $K$, $V$ to a reduced token set during attention and then decompresses the output back to the original sequence, enabling token information to be reconsidered in subsequent layers. Furthermore, Token Sparse Attention exposes a new design point at the intersection of token selection and sparse attention. Our approach is fully compatible with dense attention implementations, including Flash Attention, and can be seamlessly composed with existing sparse attention kernels. Experimental results show that Token Sparse Attention consistently improves accuracy-latency trade-off, achieving up to $\times$3.23 attention speedup at 128K context with less than 1% accuracy degradation. These results demonstrate that dynamic and interleaved token-level sparsification is a complementary and effective strategy for scalable long-context inference.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为“Token Sparse Attention”的轻量级动态注意力稀疏化机制，通过压缩和解压缩 Q, K, V 来减少参与注意力的 Token 数量，从而在不显著牺牲准确性的前提下，大幅提高长上下文推理的速度。
AI.motivation: 现有的大语言模型在处理长上下文时，其注意力机制的二次复杂度是一个主要的瓶颈。现有的加速方法要么采用结构化稀疏注意力，要么在特定层永久移除 Token，这些方法可能导致模型保留无关信息或过早做出不可逆的决策，未能充分考虑 Token 在不同层的重要性动态变化。
AI.method: 本文提出的 Token Sparse Attention 是一种动态 Token 级稀疏化机制。它在计算注意力时，首先将每头（per-head）的 Q、K、V 压缩到一组缩减的 Token 集合，然后在计算完成后将输出解压缩回原始序列长度。这种方法允许 Token 信息在后续层被重新考虑，并且可以与现有的密集注意力实现（如 Flash Attention）以及稀疏注意力核无缝结合。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，Token Sparse Attention 能够持续改善精度-延迟权衡。在 128K 的上下文长度下，该方法实现了高达 3.23 倍的注意力速度提升，同时准确率仅下降不到 1%。
AI.conclusion: 动态且交错的 Token 级稀疏化是一种有效的、可扩展的长上下文推理策略，能够与现有的注意力机制互补，显著提升效率。

title: General Agents Contain World Models, even under Partial Observability and Stochasticity
summary:
Deciding whether an agent possesses a model of its surrounding world is a fundamental step toward understanding its capabilities and limitations. In [10], it was shown that, within a particular framework, every almost optimal and general agent necessarily contains sufficient knowledge of its environment to allow an approximate reconstruction of it by querying the agent as a black box. This result relied on the assumptions that the agent is deterministic and that the environment is fully observable.
  In this work, we remove both assumptions by extending the theorem to stochastic agents operating in partially observable environments. Fundamentally, this shows that stochastic agents cannot avoid learning their environment through the usage of randomization. We also strengthen the result by weakening the notion of generality, proving that less powerful agents already contain a model of the world in which they operate.

AI.tldr: 该研究将先前关于确定性、全可观察环境中智能体模型学习的理论扩展到随机的、部分可观察的环境中，并证明了随机性是智能体学习其环境的必然途径，即使是能力较弱的智能体也包含世界模型。
AI.motivation: 先前的工作证明了在特定条件下，几乎最优和通用的智能体必然包含其环境的模型。然而，这种结果依赖于确定性和完全可观察性的假设，这些假设在现实世界中并不总是成立。因此，研究的动机是将这一理论推广到更普遍的、随机的、部分可观察的环境中。
AI.method: 通过数学推导和理论分析，将先前证明（[10]）中的定理扩展到随机智能体和部分可观察的环境。研究者们还通过放宽通用性的概念来加强结果，证明能力较弱的智能体也已包含其操作环境的模型。
AI.result: 证明了在随机和部分可观察的环境中，智能体无法避免通过使用随机化来学习其环境。此外，研究表明，即使是能力较弱的智能体也已经包含了一个它们所处世界模型。
AI.conclusion: 该研究成功地将关于智能体模型学习的理论扩展到了更广泛的场景，表明随机性是智能体学习其环境的关键机制，并且模型学习并非仅限于最通用或最优的智能体。

title: ATACompressor: Adaptive Task-Aware Compression for Efficient Long-Context Processing in LLMs
summary: Long-context inputs in large language models (LLMs) often suffer from the "lost in the middle" problem, where critical information becomes diluted or ignored due to excessive length. Context compression methods aim to address this by reducing input size, but existing approaches struggle with balancing information preservation and compression efficiency. We propose Adaptive Task-Aware Compressor (ATACompressor), which dynamically adjusts compression based on the specific requirements of the task. ATACompressor employs a selective encoder that compresses only the task-relevant portions of long contexts, ensuring that essential information is preserved while reducing unnecessary content. Its adaptive allocation controller perceives the length of relevant content and adjusts the compression rate accordingly, optimizing resource utilization. We evaluate ATACompressor on three QA datasets: HotpotQA, MSMARCO, and SQUAD-showing that it outperforms existing methods in terms of both compression efficiency and task performance. Our approach provides a scalable solution for long-context processing in LLMs. Furthermore, we perform a range of ablation studies and analysis experiments to gain deeper insights into the key components of ATACompressor.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为ATACompressor的自适应任务感知压缩器，通过动态调整压缩比例来解决长上下文LLM中的“中间丢失”问题，并在QA任务中取得了比现有方法更好的效果。
AI.motivation: 现有长上下文压缩方法在信息保留和压缩效率之间难以取得平衡，并且LLM在处理长上下文时存在“中间丢失”问题。
AI.method: ATACompressor采用选择性编码器，只压缩任务相关的部分；自适应分配控制器根据相关内容长度调整压缩率。
AI.result: 在HotpotQA、MSMARCO和SQUAD三个QA数据集上，ATACompressor在压缩效率和任务性能上均优于现有方法。
AI.conclusion: ATACompressor能够有效地解决长上下文处理中的“中间丢失”问题，为LLMs提供了可扩展的长上下文处理解决方案，并且通过消融实验深入理解了其关键组成部分。

title: HetroD: A High-Fidelity Drone Dataset and Benchmark for Autonomous Driving in Heterogeneous Traffic
comment: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2026
summary: We present HetroD, a dataset and benchmark for developing autonomous driving systems in heterogeneous environments. HetroD targets the critical challenge of navi- gating real-world heterogeneous traffic dominated by vulner- able road users (VRUs), including pedestrians, cyclists, and motorcyclists that interact with vehicles. These mixed agent types exhibit complex behaviors such as hook turns, lane splitting, and informal right-of-way negotiation. Such behaviors pose significant challenges for autonomous vehicles but remain underrepresented in existing datasets focused on structured, lane-disciplined traffic. To bridge the gap, we collect a large- scale drone-based dataset to provide a holistic observation of traffic scenes with centimeter-accurate annotations, HD maps, and traffic signal states. We further develop a modular toolkit for extracting per-agent scenarios to support downstream task development. In total, the dataset comprises over 65.4k high- fidelity agent trajectories, 70% of which are from VRUs. HetroD supports modeling of VRU behaviors in dense, het- erogeneous traffic and provides standardized benchmarks for forecasting, planning, and simulation tasks. Evaluation results reveal that state-of-the-art prediction and planning models struggle with the challenges presented by our dataset: they fail to predict lateral VRU movements, cannot handle unstructured maneuvers, and exhibit limited performance in dense and multi-agent scenarios, highlighting the need for more robust approaches to heterogeneous traffic. See our project page for more examples: https://hetroddata.github.io/HetroD/

AI.tldr: HetroD是一个新的数据集和基准，用于在包含行人、骑自行车者和摩托车等弱势道路使用者（VRU）的异构交通环境中开发自动驾驶系统。该数据集包含大量VRU轨迹，并为预测、规划和模拟任务提供了基准，展示了现有先进模型在处理复杂异构交通方面的不足。
AI.motivation: 现有自动驾驶数据集主要关注结构化、车道规矩的交通，而现实世界中以VRU为主的异构交通中的复杂行为（如鬼探头、蛇形行驶、非正式路权协商）被低估。这阻碍了自动驾驶系统在真实复杂场景下的发展。
AI.method: 收集了大规模的无人机航拍数据集，提供厘米级精度的标注、高精地图和交通信号状态，以全面观测交通场景。开发了一个模块化工具包，用于提取每个代理的场景信息，支持下游任务开发。数据集包含超过6.54万条高保真代理轨迹，其中70%来自VRU。
AI.result: 现有最先进的预测和规划模型在HetroD数据集上面临挑战，它们在预测VRU的横向移动、处理非结构化机动以及在密集和多代理场景下的表现有限。
AI.conclusion: HetroD数据集为建模VRU在密集异构交通中的行为提供了标准化基准，并揭示了当前自动驾驶模型在处理此类复杂场景时存在的局限性，强调了开发更鲁棒方法的必要性。

title: FSOD-VFM: Few-Shot Object Detection with Vision Foundation Models and Graph Diffusion
comment: Accepted by ICLR 2026. Code is available at: \url{https://intellindust-ai-lab.github.io/projects/FSOD-VFM}
summary: In this paper, we present FSOD-VFM: Few-Shot Object Detectors with Vision Foundation Models, a framework that leverages vision foundation models to tackle the challenge of few-shot object detection. FSOD-VFM integrates three key components: a universal proposal network (UPN) for category-agnostic bounding box generation, SAM2 for accurate mask extraction, and DINOv2 features for efficient adaptation to new object categories. Despite the strong generalization capabilities of foundation models, the bounding boxes generated by UPN often suffer from overfragmentation, covering only partial object regions and leading to numerous small, false-positive proposals rather than accurate, complete object detections. To address this issue, we introduce a novel graph-based confidence reweighting method. In our approach, predicted bounding boxes are modeled as nodes in a directed graph, with graph diffusion operations applied to propagate confidence scores across the network. This reweighting process refines the scores of proposals, assigning higher confidence to whole objects and lower confidence to local, fragmented parts. This strategy improves detection granularity and effectively reduces the occurrence of false-positive bounding box proposals. Through extensive experiments on Pascal-5$^i$, COCO-20$^i$, and CD-FSOD datasets, we demonstrate that our method substantially outperforms existing approaches, achieving superior performance without requiring additional training. Notably, on the challenging CD-FSOD dataset, which spans multiple datasets and domains, our FSOD-VFM achieves 31.6 AP in the 10-shot setting, substantially outperforming previous training-free methods that reach only 21.4 AP. Code is available at: https://intellindust-ai-lab.github.io/projects/FSOD-VFM.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了FSOD-VFM框架，利用视觉基础模型（包括UPN、SAM2和DINOv2）进行少样本目标检测，并通过一种新的图论置信度重加权方法解决了边界框碎片化问题，在多个数据集上取得了优于现有方法的性能。
AI.motivation: 少数样本目标检测（Few-Shot Object Detection, FSOD）面临着如何有效利用有限标注数据检测新类别的挑战。现有方法在利用视觉基础模型的泛化能力时，其生成的边界框存在碎片化问题，导致检测精度下降。
AI.method: FSOD-VFM框架集成了三个组件：1. 通用候选框网络（UPN）用于类别无关的边界框生成；2. SAM2用于精确的掩码提取；3. DINOv2特征用于适应新类别。核心创新是引入了一种图论置信度重加权方法，将预测边界框建模为有向图的节点，通过图扩散传播置信度，从而提升完整物体的置信度并降低碎片化部分的置信度。
AI.result: 在Pascal-5$^i$, COCO-20$^i$, 和CD-FSOD数据集上进行了大量实验。FSOD-VFM在无需额外训练的情况下，显著优于现有方法。特别是在CD-FSOD数据集上，10-shot设置下达到了31.6 AP，远超之前训练无关方法（21.4 AP）。
AI.conclusion: FSOD-VFM框架成功地利用了视觉基础模型的强大能力，并通过创新的图论置信度重加权方法有效解决了少样本目标检测中的边界框碎片化问题，实现了无需额外训练即可获得优越的检测性能。

title: Enhancing Foundation VLM Robustness to Missing Modality: Scalable Diffusion for Bi-directional Feature Restoration
summary: Vision Language Models (VLMs) typically assume complete modality input during inference. However, their effectiveness drops sharply when certain modalities are unavailable or incomplete. Current research primarily faces two dilemmas: Prompt-based methods struggle to restore missing yet indispensable features and impair generalization of VLMs. Imputation-based approaches, lacking effective guidance, are prone to generating semantically irrelevant noise. Restoring precise semantics while sustaining VLM generalization remains challenging. Therefore, we propose a general missing modality restoration strategy in this paper. We introduce an enhanced diffusion model as a pluggable mid-stage training module to effectively restore missing features. Our strategy introduces two key innovations: (I) Dynamic Modality Gating, which adaptively leverages conditional features to steer the generation of semantically consistent features; (II) Cross-Modal Mutual Learning mechanism, which bridges the semantic spaces of dual encoders to achieve bidirectional alignment.
